         <tei:p>Cothonaspis dulcis sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 59, 60, 71)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, clavate, segments 3 and 4 subequal, 5 shorter than 4, 6 shorter<tei:lb/>than 5, 7-13 forming a distinct club, all club segments with rhinaria (Fig. 59). Head, viewed frontally, with<tei:lb/>eyes further apart than height of an eye measured medially, cheeks converging towards clypeal area, malar<tei:lb/>groove distinct. Pronotal plate projected forward, anterior and posterior parts bridged medially, lateral<tei:lb/>fovea open on margins (Fig. 60). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, scutellar fovea smooth, shallow, lateral<tei:lb/>bars polished, scutellar disc almost truncate viewed dorsally, surface reticulate-rugose, scutellar cup long,<tei:lb/>narrow, narrower apically than medially, extending almost to apex of disc (Fig. 71). Propodeal carinae<tei:lb/>parallel, weakly pubescent on lateral margins, mesopleurae smooth, polished, mesopleural suture<tei:lb/>complete, a few rugae present below suture adjacent to lateral margins of pronotal plate, metapleura<tei:lb/>polished. Segment 1 of gaster short, broad, crenulate, in form of a ring, tergite 2 the largest, tergites 3 and 4<tei:lb/>visible in lateral view, apex of tergite 2 and whole of visible parts of 3 and 4 finely punctate, tergite 2 with a<tei:lb/>small tuft of hairs on lateral margins not prominent or obscuring tergite 1, hypopygium not pronounced,<tei:lb/>ventral spine not visible. Legs long, slender. Wings long, narrow, rounded apically, surface pubescent with<tei:lb/>apical hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on wing margin. Colour: antenna dark yellow basally,<tei:lb/>brownish medially, apical 3-4 segments light yellow, head reddish black, thorax and gaster chestnut-<tei:lb/>brown, legs orange-brown.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: Kibati, 1000 m, 10-12.U934 (G. F. de Witte) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Zaire: 21 $ (MRAC). Madagascar: 1 $ (MNHN).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cothonaspis ealis sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 61, 62)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, with 5-segmented club, segment 3 longer than 4, 4 longer than 5,<tei:lb/>6-8 subequal, each slightly longer than 5 (Fig. 61). Head, viewed frontally, rounded, eyes oval, face<tei:lb/>smooth, shining, with sparse scattered hairs, malar groove percurrent, vertex smooth. Pronotal plate<tei:lb/>produced forward, anterior and posterior parts connected medially, lateral margins, i.e. fovea, open<tei:lb/>laterally (Fig. 62); pronotum weakly striated on dorsal surface adjacent to mesoscutum; mesoscutum<tei:lb/>smooth, polished, with a few scattered hairs; lateral bars of scutellum smooth, polished, scutellar fovea<tei:lb/>shallow, almost as broad as long, scutellar disc polished, with trace of broken striae, apex rounded, cup<tei:lb/>small, long, narrow. Propodeal carinae parallel, without pubescence on lateral margins, propodeum<tei:lb/>elongate, carinate, hairless; mesopleural suture complete, mesopleurae smooth, polished; metapleura<tei:lb/>ridged, an tero ventral cavity distinct, with a few setae. Segment 1 of gaster short, broad, in the form of a<tei:lb/>crenulate ring, tergite 2 the largest, smooth, polished, without a ring of pubescence at base, impuncate,<tei:lb/>tergites 3 and 4 partially visible in lateral view, hypopygium not pronounced, ventral spine not visible. Legs<tei:lb/>short, robust, tarsal segments longer than tibia. Wings pubescent, margins ciliate, radial cell of forewing<tei:lb/>closed on wing margin. Colour: antenna light brown, head, thorax and gaster brown-black, legs yellowish.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Cothonaspis fenerivae (Kieffer)</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Kieffer 's description is based on a male and could fit a number of species.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 257</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented with a 5-segmented club, segment 3 subequal to 4+5, 4 longer<tei:lb/>than 5 (8th segment weakly swollen but not regarded as a club segment, rhinaria are not present as in the<tei:lb/>five apical segments) (Fig. 57). Head, viewed frontally, rounded, eyes normally rounded, smallish, malar<tei:lb/>space area striated, face with sparse hairs, maxillary palp 4-segmented, labial palp 2-segmented, vertex<tei:lb/>strigose. Pronotal plate projected forward, anterior and posterior parts connected medially, lateral<tei:lb/>margins open, i.e. fovea open laterally (Fig. 58); mesoscutum smooth, polished, with sparse hairs,<tei:lb/>notaulices absent. Lateral bars of scutellum striate dorsally, polished, scutellar fovea smooth, shallow, as<tei:lb/>broad as long, scutellar disc with longitudinal or radiating ridges, cup small, slightly longer than broad.<tei:lb/>Propodeal carinae pronounced, parallel, propodeum elongated in lateral view, a few sparse hairs present<tei:lb/>(Fig. 63). Mesoscutum, in lateral view, long, slender. Mesopleural suture complete, strigose above suture,<tei:lb/>metapleura ridged, antero ventral cavity indicated. Segment 1 of gaster broad, short, canaliculate, tergite 2<tei:lb/>the largest in lateral view, with a few long hairs at its base. Legs long, slender, fore and mid-legs of similar<tei:lb/>size and shape, hind-leg larger, tarsi short, hind coxa strigose. Wings narrow, rounded apically, surface<tei:lb/>pubescent with hair fringe on apical margin, radial cell of forewing closed (sometimes indistinctly so, due to<tei:lb/>presence only of pigmentation, the vein becoming vestigial). Colour: antenna brownish, head and thorax<tei:lb/>black, gaster dark brownish black, chestnut-red basally. Legs brownish basally, yellowish apically.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Although pentatoma appears to be known only from Europe it is included in the key to species to<tei:lb/>facilitate identification and comparison with the two Afrotropical species.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>EALATA gen. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 19, 20, 69)<tei:lb/>Type-species: Ealata clava sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DIAGNOSIS. 9 antenna 13-segmented, clavate, c? antenna 15-segmented, filiform, segment 3 curved,<tei:lb/>subequal in length to segment 4. Pronotal plate not projected forward, anterior part wider than posterior<tei:lb/>part, fovea large, not enclosed on lateral margin (Fig. 20). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices<tei:lb/>weakly indicated basally, foveae broader than long, kidney-shaped; scutellar disc reticulate-rugose,<tei:lb/>weakly rounded apically, scutellar cup oval, slightly longer than broad, raised, with a weak depression<tei:lb/>apically, with a pale-edged rim (Fig. 69). Propodeum with bowed carinae, pubescent on either side.<tei:lb/>Mesopleura smooth, polished, suture complete. Segment 1 of gaster partially visible, sculptured, in form of<tei:lb/>a crescent, tergite 2 the largest in lateral view, without a ring of pubescence at base, at most with a few<tei:lb/>scattered hairs on lateral margins. Wings pubescent, apical margins with a hair fringe, radial cell of<tei:lb/>forewing closed on wing margin (Fig. 19). Legs of normal size and shape, coxae with a fringe of hairs on<tei:lb/>margins viewed laterally, dark brown, femora, tibiae and tarsi orange-yellow with usual pubescence.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISTRIBUTION. Afrotropical Region.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISCUSSION. This genus superficially resembles Leptopilina. However, the pronotal plate is not projected<tei:lb/>forward, and the notaulices, though aberrant, are indicated at least on the anterior of the mesoscutum.<tei:lb/>Tergite 2 of the gaster has a few hairs present laterally, never with a ring of pubescence, however thin.<tei:lb/>Ealata is closely related to Nordlanderia, Disorygma and Diglyphosema. It is separated from Disorygma by<tei:lb/>the mesoscutum and the form of the scutellar cup.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: Eala, ii.1935 (/. Ghesquiere) (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratypes. Cameroun: 2 $ (BMNH). Kenya: 1 $ (BMNH). Mauritius: 1 cf (BMNH). South Africa: 2 $<tei:lb/>(BMNH). Uganda: 2 $ (BMNH). Principe Is.: 1 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 34 $, 19 cf (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISCUSSION. This species is separated from others in the genus by the club segments; these can be easily<tei:lb/>counted and comprise seven segments, but rhinaria are not present on the seventh. The sixth segment,<tei:lb/>although very similar in shape to the other club segments, does not have rhinaria and is therefore not<tei:lb/>regarded as a true club segment.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Ealata marica sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 19, 20, 64, 69)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, subclavate, segment 3 1-3 x length of 4, 4, 5 and 6 subequal in<tei:lb/>length, 7-13 forming a club, each club segment with rhinaria, weakly swollen medially, apical segment<tei:lb/>shorter than 11 + 12 (Fig. 66). Face, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, with scattered hairs, malar suture<tei:lb/>distinct, eyes as far apart measured medially as height of an eye. Pronotal plate not projected forward,<tei:lb/>anterior part wider than posterior part, the lateral foveae large, not enclosed (cf. Fig. 20). Mesoscutum<tei:lb/>channelled from lateral margins to pronotal plate, notaulices not indicated, sparse hairs present in their<tei:lb/>place, lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar foveae shallow, wider than long, scutellar cup small,<tei:lb/>slightly longer than wide, not extending to apex of disc, scutellar disc finely reticulate-rugose, apex<tei:lb/>rounded (cf. Fig. 69); propodeum obscured by pubescence, mesopleural suture complete, metapleura<tei:lb/>densely pubescent, propodeum extended. Segment 1 of gaster in form of a crenulate ring, obscured by base<tei:lb/>of tergite 2, tergite 2 the largest, with two or three hairs basally on lateral margins, remaining segments not<tei:lb/>visible, hypopygium long, narrow (Fig. 64). Wing surface densely pubescent, margins with apical hair<tei:lb/>fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on margin, long, narrow (Fig. 19). Legs short, stout, hind coxa swollen<tei:lb/>medially, tibia as long as tarsus.          <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED<tei:lb/>Holotype $, Zaire: Kivu, Rutshuru, 1285 m, ll.vii.1935 (G. F. de Witte) (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is easily distinguished by the antenna and extremely long, narrow hypopygium.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Ealata saba sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Nigeria: Ibadan (B. R. Critchley) (BMNH).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratypes. Nigeria: 4 $ (BMNH). Rhodesia: 1 $ (BMNH). South Africa: 2 $ (BMNH). Uganda: 2 $<tei:lb/>(BMNH). Zaire: 6 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is separated from clava by the distinctive antennal club (Fig. 65).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>EUCOILIDEA Ashmead<tei:lb/>(Figs 84, 86, 93, 101)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Eucoilidea Ashmead, 1887: 154. Type-species: Eucoilidea canadensis Ashmead, by subsequent designa-<tei:lb/>tion, Ashmead, 1903: 60.<tei:lb/>Afrostilba Benoit, 1956: 544. Type-species: Afrostilba nitida Benoit, by monotypy. Syn. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DIAGNOSIS. $ antenna usually 13-segmented, clavate to almost filiform, club segments distinguished by<tei:lb/>presence of rhinaria, cf antenna 15-segmented. Face smooth, shining, malar space with a distinct<tei:lb/>epistomal suture (malar ridge), mandibles tridentate. Pronotal plate weakly protruding viewed dorsally,<tei:lb/>cavities either side of median bridge open laterally (Fig. 101). Pronotum either side of pronotal plate<tei:lb/>polished to strongly aciculate. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices complete, distinct, converging on<tei:lb/>approach to scutellum where medial distance between notaulices can vary (Figs 86, 93); lateral bars of<tei:lb/>scutellum smooth, scutellar fovea deep, scutellar cup variable, from oval to round to elongate, scutellar<tei:lb/>disc usually visible laterally and apically though this is sometimes overlapped apically by scutellar cup, apex<tei:lb/>of disc rounded (Figs 86, 93, 97). Segment 1 of gaster sulcate, short, as broad as long, segment 2 occupying<tei:lb/>almost whole of visible part of gaster in lateral view (Fig. 14), surface without punctures at x45<tei:lb/>magnification. Wings with apical fringe of hairs, surface pubescent, radial cell of forewing closed on wing<tei:lb/>margin (Fig. 84).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISCUSSION. The holotype of Eucoilidea canadensis Ashmead is a $ and has its antenna missing and is<tei:lb/>badly obscured by glue. Nineteen species, including seventeen newly described, are recognized from the<tei:lb/>Afrotropical region. Weld (1952) states that the antenna in the $ of canadensis has the third segment<tei:lb/>slightly longer than the fourth, without a distinct club, cf with segment three twice the length of four and<tei:lb/>strongly bent. In a $ from the West Indies the third segment is slightly shorter than four. The holotype<tei:lb/>would run in the present key to dubia but differs in the ratios of the antennal segments, the shape of the cup<tei:lb/>and the acuteness of the notaulices on approaching the scutellum. Afrostilba is here synonymised with<tei:lb/>Eucoilidea after comparison with related genera. First examination of Afrostilba, using Weld's key (1952)<tei:lb/>based on scutellar characters, distinguishes it from Eucoilidea by the absence of striations in the malar area<tei:lb/>of the face together with scutellar differences which also separate it from Microstilba. However, the<tei:lb/>emphasis given to the scutellar characters after comparison with the holotype of Eucoilidea canadensis and<tei:lb/>the species described here do not merit a separate genus. Eucoilidea has been recorded by Weld (1952)<tei:lb/>from the U.S.A., Mexico, Hawaii and the Philippines. The type-species is from Canada. Undescribed<tei:lb/>species of Eucoilidea from India and Singapore are in the BMNH. Afrostilba nitida Benoit is transferred to<tei:lb/>Eucoilidea.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISTRIBUTION. North and South America, Hawaii, Philippines, South Africa.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Key to the Afrotropical species of Eucoilidea Ashmead</tei:p>

Fig. 101); mesoscutum with distinct notaulices, converging gently on approach to scutellum but<tei:lb/>not merging, scutellar disc rugose-reticulate, visible laterally and posteriorly, scutellar cup longer than</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 263</tei:p>
         <tei:p>broad, apical half with a large fovea (Fig. 104), scutellar foveae deep, lateral bars of scutellum broad and<tei:lb/>polished; propodeum with parallel carinae, mesopleura smooth, shining, with a distinct suture. Segment 1<tei:lb/>of gaster short, crenulate, as wide as long, segment 2 the largest, occupying most of visible area in lateral<tei:lb/>view, segment 3 partially visible in lateral view, gaster impunctate, hypopygium with long basal setae,<tei:lb/>ovipositor sheath long (cf. Fig. 94). Legs yellowish orange, tibiae with two apical spurs, claws simple.<tei:lb/>Wings pubescent on surface, with apical fringe of hairs, radial cell of forewing closed on wing margin,<tei:lb/>elongate, Rs+M and M indicated, pigmented basally, base of wing with a smoky appearance (cf. Fig. 112).<tei:lb/>Colour: antenna yellow basally, apical segments dark, head and thorax black, gaster chestnut-brown-<tei:lb/>black, legs yellowish orange.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ .          <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is similar toparma but the antennae have an overall filiform appearance; it is also<tei:lb/>very close to nitida but is distinguished by the shape of the antenna and the notaulices.</tei:p>

Antenna 14-segmented, subclavate, 8-14 forming a weak club, segments 3-8 subequal in<tei:lb/>length, 9-11 subequal, shorter than preceding segments, 12 and 13 each shorter than segment 11, apical<tei:lb/>segment as long as segment 3 (Fig. 76). Antenna 13-segmented, filiform, segment 4 longer than 3, 7-13 each progressively shorter<tei:lb/>than preceding segment, all of equal width, rhinaria present on segments 4-13 (Fig. 124).          <tei:p>Description. $. Antenna 13-segmented, filiform, segment 3 1-2 x as long as 4, 5-12 each progressively<tei:lb/>decreasing in length (Fig. 129), 4-13 with rhinaria. Face viewed frontally, smooth, shining, with scattered<tei:lb/>pubescence, malar space with a distinct suture, mandibles tridentate, maxillary palp 4-segmented, labial<tei:lb/>palp 2-segmented, eyes elongate, oval, further apart than height of an eye measured medially; pronotal<tei:lb/>plate not protruding, viewed fronto-dorsally minute, with lateral fovea open either side of medial bridge,<tei:lb/>pronotum either side of pronotal plate densely pubescent.          <tei:p>Eucoilidea nitida (Benoit) comb. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 115, 133, 134, 135,137)<tei:lb/>Afrostilba nitida Benoit, 1956: 544. Holotype $, ZAIRE (MRAC) [examined].</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, subclavate, segments 3 and 4 equal in length, 4-13 forming a<tei:lb/>weak club, each segment slightly shorter and wider in length than preceding one (Fig. 133), apical segment<tei:lb/>never twice as long as wide. Face, viewed frontally, smooth, shining, malar space with a distinct epistomal<tei:lb/>suture, eyes diverging at top and bottom, frontal area pronounced, mandibles tridentate. Pronotum either<tei:lb/>side of pronotal plate smooth, sometimes with weak sculpture on the margins. Pronotal plate not projected<tei:lb/>forward, lateral fovea either side of medial bridge open laterally, fovea broad, narrow, separated by a<tei:lb/>narrow bridge medially (Fig. 134). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices distinct, gradually converg-<tei:lb/>ing on approach to scutellar suture, almost as far apart at juncture as half width of scutellar cup, scutellar<tei:lb/>foveae smooth, polished, scutellar disc punctate-reticulate, with scattered hairs, scutellar cup almost oval,<tei:lb/>with a large apical fovea (Fig. 137), rim of cup with small fovea on lateral margin, apex of disc obscured by<tei:lb/>cup; carinae of propodeum parallel, pubescent on outer margins. Mesopleura with a distinct suture,<tei:lb/>metapleura smooth, polished. Segment 1 of gaster short, wider than long, crenulate, segment 2 the largest<tei:lb/>in lateral view, densely punctured on apical half viewed laterally, remaining segments not visible,<tei:lb/>hypopygium short. Legs yellow, coxae yellow, meta- tarsus as long as tarsal segments 2-4 combined, tibiae<tei:lb/>with two apical spurs, tarsal claws simple. Wings pubescent on surface, apical margins with a hair fringe,<tei:lb/>radial cell of forewing closed on anterior margin, Rs+M and M weakly indicated, radial cell 4 x as long as<tei:lb/>broad, elongate (Fig. 135), 2rm as broad as long. Colour: antenna yellowish black basally, black apically,<tei:lb/>head and thorax black, gaster dark chestnut-red-brown, legs yellowish.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cf . Antenna 15-segmented, filiform, segment 3 the largest, strongly curved, swollen apically, longer<tei:lb/>than 4 (Fig. 115).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: Kivu, Rutshuru, ll.v.1936 (L. Lippens) (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratypes. Ghana: 2 $, 5 C? (BMNH). Kenya: 11 $, 1 cf (BMNH). South Africa: 1 $ (BMNH). Zaire:<tei:lb/>27 $, 2 Cf (MRAC). Zambia: 3 $ (BMNH). Zimbabwe: 1 $ (BMNH).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. A difficult species to separate from conversa, but distinguished from it by the overall shape of the<tei:lb/>antenna and the convergence of the notaulices towards the scutellar suture (Figs 133, 137).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Eucoilidea pallida sp. n.</tei:p>

Fig. 117). Pronotum either side of pronotal plate crenulate-<tei:lb/>foveolate (cf. Fig. 83), pronotal plate not protruding, lateral fovea either side open laterally.          <tei:p>Eucoilidea tyrus sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Eucoilidea urundiensis Benoit</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 98, 99, 100, 139)<tei:lb/>Eucoilidea urundiensis Benoit, 1956: 548. Holotype $, ZAIRE (MRAC) [examined].</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, subclavate, segment 3 longer than 4, 5 shorter than 4, 5-13 with<tei:lb/>rhinaria, forming a weak club (Fig. 98). Face, viewed frontally, smooth, shining, with long scattered<tei:lb/>pubescence, malar space with epistomal suture, eyes slightly further apart than height of an eye measured<tei:lb/>medially, weakly converging, mandibles tridentate. Pronotal plate not produced forward, foveae either<tei:lb/>side of medial, bridge open. Pronotum either side of plate with sparse scattered hairs on an aciculate<tei:lb/>surface. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices distinct, converging sharply towards scutellar suture<tei:lb/>two-thirds from scutellar suture, scutellar fovea large, smooth, polished, scutellar cup large, almost round,<tei:lb/>with a large central fovea, rim of cup with a few fovea around edges, scutellar disc rounded apically , surface<tei:lb/>reticulate-rugose (cf.          <tei:p>Cf . Antenna 15-segmented, segment 3 longer than 4, curved, flattened on outer margins (Fig. 99).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Zaire: 1 $ (holotype), Urundi (Mosso), Makoronkwe, 1450 m, 12.iii.1953 (P. Basilewsky) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Uganda: 1 cf (BMNH). Zaire: 12 $ (MRAC). Zimbabwe: 1 $ (BMNH). (All paratypes.)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>HEXACOLA Foerster</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Hexacola Foerster, 1869: 342. Type-species: Eucoela picicrus Giraud, by monotypy.<tei:lb/>Hexaplasta Foerster, 1869: 345. Type-species: Cothonaspis hexatoma Hartig, 1841: 357, by original<tei:lb/>designation. [Synonymy by Rohwer &amp; Pagan, 1917.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DIAGNOSIS. $ antenna generally 13-segmented but in some species 11-12 segmented, clavate, cf antenna<tei:lb/>15-segmented, segment 3 curved, longer than 4th (Fig. 39) ; wings pubescent, ciliate, radial cell of forewing<tei:lb/>open on front margin (vein R\ projecting slightly on margin but not joining Rs 2 ), Rs+M and M (cubitus)<tei:lb/>indicated; scutellar cup elliptical, not extending to apex of disc, scutellar disc striate on lateral margins.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISCUSSION. Closely related to Kleidotoma but distinguished by the shape of the radial cell of the forewing<tei:lb/>and the absence of an incision on the apical margin of the wing. In Hexacola the apex of the forewing is<tei:lb/>normally rounded, neither truncate nor incised. The scutellar disc is not as distinctly striated as in<tei:lb/>Kleidotoma and the wings are generally narrow.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISTRIBUTION. Europe; South Africa; North and South America.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>BIOLOGY. The type-species of Hexaplasta is a known parasite of Oscinella frit (L), the frit fly (Imms, 1930;<tei:lb/>Kerrich &amp; Quinlan, 1960).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Nordlander (1981) notes that some earlier authors considered that the nominal species<tei:lb/>designated by Foerster as type-species of Hexacola was misidentified and that in fact the species was<tei:lb/>Kleidotoma hexatoma Thomson, 1862 (Kieffer, 1901 , 1902; Ashmead, 1903; Dalla Torre &amp; Kieffer, 1910).<tei:lb/>Ashmead (1903) also designated K. hexatoma Thomson as type-species of Hexacola. Rohwer &amp; Fagan<tei:lb/>(1917) concluded that Eucoela picicrus Giraud, 1860 is the type-species of Hexacola by original designation<tei:lb/>and monotypy. They made Hexaplasta Foerster a junior synonym of Hexacola, thereby acting as first<tei:lb/>revisers. Nordlander (1981) is submitting a case to the International Commission on Zoological Nomencla-<tei:lb/>ture to decide on the type-species designation, and states that he has compared a female in the Foerster<tei:lb/>collection, labelled 'Hexacola picicrus Giraud', with syntypes of Kleidotoma hexatoma Thomson, and<tei:lb/>considers them to be conspecific.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Key to the Afrotropical species of Hexacola Foerster</tei:p>

         <tei:p>274 J. QUINLAN</tei:p>
         <tei:p>flagellar segments 1-6, 4-6 quadrate (Fig. 149). Head, viewed frontally, a little longer than broad, smooth,<tei:lb/>shining, eyes almost round, further apart measured medially than height of an eye, malar groove distinct.<tei:lb/>Pronotal plate projected forward, anterior and posterior parts joined by narrow medial bridge, fovea on<tei:lb/>either side open on lateral margins (Fig. 40); pronotum either side of pronotal plate with a tuft of<tei:lb/>pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent, lateral bars of scutellum polished with a<tei:lb/>few striations apically; scutellar foveae wider than long, angular, scutellar cup long, narrow, polished,<tei:lb/>weakly excavate, not extending to apex of disc (cf. Fig. 168), scutellar disc with broken longitudinal<tei:lb/>striations laterally, apex rounded; propodeal carinae obscured by pubescence. Mesopleura smooth,<tei:lb/>polished, suture complete [metapleura not entire due to pin on which the specimen is mounted]. Segment 1<tei:lb/>of gaster obscured by a ring of pubescence at base of tergite 2, not complete on dorsal surface, tergites 3 and<tei:lb/>4 visible in lateral view, punctate, hypopygium not prominent.          <tei:p>Hexacola amantia sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented with a weakly defined, 7-segmented club, flagellar segments 3-6<tei:lb/>each longer than wide, 3 longer than 4 (Fig. 161). Pronotum either side of plate with a tuft of hairs.<tei:lb/>Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent, lateral bars of scutellum smooth, polished, scutellar<tei:lb/>fovea narrow, angularly opposed to each other, smooth, polished, scutellar cup oval-elongate, lateral<tei:lb/>margins of scutellar disc narrow, weakly striated (almost smooth in some specimens), apex of disc<tei:lb/>reticulate-rugose, rounded (cf. Fig. 167), propodeal carinae subparallel, weakly bowed posteriorly at<tei:lb/>juncture with nucha, lateral margins of propodeum densely pubescent. Head, viewed<tei:lb/>frontally, a little longer than wide, eyes semi-circular, further apart than height of an eye measured<tei:lb/>medially, weakly converging towards clypeus, vertex polished. Pronotal plate produced forward, anterior<tei:lb/>and posterior connected by a medial bridge, the fovea open on lateral margins, pronotum either side of<tei:lb/>pronotal plate with tufts of pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent, lateral bars of<tei:lb/>scutellum polished, scutellar foveae kidney-shaped, smooth, polished, scutellar cup small, little longer</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 279</tei:p>
         <tei:p>than broad, not extending to apex of disc, scutellar disc with longitudinally radiating striae on lateral<tei:lb/>margins, coriaceous at apex, apex rounded (Fig. 173); propodeal carinae parallel, converging at base,<tei:lb/>densely woolly on lateral margins. Mesopleura and metapleura smooth, polished, mesopleural carinae<tei:lb/>distinct. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by dense ring of pubescence at base of tergite 2, complete on dorsal<tei:lb/>surface, tergites 2-4 visible in lateral view, tergite 2 the largest visible segment, apex of 3-5 punctate,<tei:lb/>hypopygium short, broad basally, ventral spine short. Wings densely pubescent with long apical hair<tei:lb/>fringe, fore wing short, broad apically, radial cell of forewing open on margin, vein RI weakly indicated in<tei:lb/>part (Fig. 172). Legs normal except trochanters long, narrow, mid and hind coxae swollen basally. Colour:<tei:lb/>antenna yellowish brown basally, club segments darker, head brownish, thorax orange-yellow, gaster<tei:lb/>chestnut-brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>O" unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: Massif Ruwenzori, riv. Kakalari, affl. Bombi, 1,725 m, 10. iv. 1954 (R. Vanschuyt-<tei:lb/>broeck &amp; H. Synave) (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratypes. South Africa: 3 $ (BMNH). Uganda: 1 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 11 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Distinguished from quinqueclavata by the antennal segment ratios (Fig. 154).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Hexacola septemius sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Fig. 160)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented with sharply defined 7-segmented club, longer than flagellar<tei:lb/>segments 1-6 combined, segment 3 equal in length to 4+5 (Fig. 160). Head, viewed frontally, smooth,<tei:lb/>polished, with one or two hairs above supraclypeal area, cheeks converging, eyes further apart than height<tei:lb/>of an eye measured medially between eyes, malar grooves distinct. Pronotal plate projected forward,<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts connected by a narrow medial bridge, fovea on either side open laterally,<tei:lb/>lateral margins of pronotum on either side of plate without tufts of pubescence, at most a few setae present.<tei:lb/>Mesoscutum smooth, polished, without trace of notaulices, lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar<tei:lb/>fovea kidney-shaped, wider than long, scutellar cup long, narrow, polished, not extending to apex of disc,<tei:lb/>lateral margins of disc with broken longitudinal striations, basally reticulate-rugose, rounded apically.<tei:lb/>Propodeal carinae parallel, pubescent on lateral margins. Mesopleural suture complete, mesopleura and<tei:lb/>metapleura smooth, polished. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of tergite<tei:lb/>2, ring complete on dorsal surface, tergites 2-4 visible in lateral view, tergite 2 the largest, apex of tergite 2<tei:lb/>and visible parts of tergites 3+4 punctate, hypopygium not prominent, ventral spine short. Wing surface<tei:lb/>pubescent, apical margins with a fringe of hairs, apex rounded, radial cell of forewing open on margin, vein<tei:lb/>RI projected partially along margin. Colour: antenna yellow basally, club segments darker, head, thorax<tei:lb/>and gaster chestnut-brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>C? unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: 10.vii.1952 (H. deSaeger) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Zaire: 2 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Distinguished from amantia, a closely similar species, by the sharply defined club of the antenna<tei:lb/>(Fig. 160).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Hexacola zama sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 148, 152, 174)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 12-segmented with a sharply defined, 6-segmented club, the club much longer<tei:lb/>than flagellar segments 1-6, flagellar segments 4-6 as wide as long (Fig. 152). Head, viewed frontally,<tei:lb/>smooth, polished, supraclypeal area and mandibles with a few scattered hairs, eyes almost spherical,<tei:lb/>slightly further apart measured medially, than height of an eye, anterior tentorial pits weakly indicated,<tei:lb/>malar grooves complete, cheeks weakly converging, vertex polished. Pronotal plate projected forward,<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts connected by a narrow medial bridge, fovea on either side open laterally (cf.<tei:lb/>Fig. 148). Pronotum either side of plate with a few hairs. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent,<tei:lb/>lateral bars of scutellum striate dorsally, polished laterally, scutellar fovea kidney-shaped, polished,<tei:lb/>scutellar cup elliptical, longer than wide, the rim paler than inner surfaces, apical quarter with a fovea,<tei:lb/>lateral margins of scutellar disc with broken reticulate-rugose sculpture appearing striated (Fig. 174), apex</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>280 J. QUINLAN</tei:p>
         <tei:p>of disc rounded, surface reticulate-rugose. Propodeal carinae subparallel. Mesopleural carinae complete,<tei:lb/>meso- and metapleura smooth, polished. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at<tei:lb/>base of tergite 2, complete on dorsal surface, tergites 3+4 partially visible, weakly punctate, hypopygium<tei:lb/>short, broad basally, ventral spine not visible. Wing surface pubescent, apical margins with a fringe of<tei:lb/>hairs, radial cell of forewing open on margin, vein RI extending partially along margin. Legs normal.<tei:lb/>Colour: antenna brownish yellow, head, thorax and gaster chestnut-brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED<tei:lb/>Holotype $, Zaire: N. Lac, Kivu, Rwanki, xii.1951 (/. V. Leroy) (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is separated from atropos by the relative lengths of the antennal segments.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>KLEIDOTOMA Westwood</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Kleidotoma Westwood, 1833: 494. Type-species: Kleidotoma psiloides Westwood, by monotypy.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Aphyoptera Foerster, 1869: 343. Type-species: Aphyoptera inustipennis Foerster, by monotypy. [Synony-<tei:lb/>mised by Hellen, 1960: 23.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Aphiloptera Foerster, 1869: 351. Type-species: Aphiloptera anisomera Foerster, by monotypy. [Synony-<tei:lb/>mised by Quinlan, 1967: 1.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Agroscopa Foerster, 1869: 352. Type-species: Agroscopa helgolandica Foerster, by monotypy. [Synony-<tei:lb/>mised by Quinlan, 1967: 1.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Nedinoptera Foerster, 1869: 350. Type-species: Nedinoptera halophila Thomson, by monotypy. [Synony-<tei:lb/>mised by Quinlan, 1967: 1.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhynchacis Foerster, 1869: 349. Type-species: Cothonaspis nigra Hartig, by monotypy. [Synonymised by<tei:lb/>Quinlan, 1978: 25.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Pentacrita Foerster, 1869: 349. Type-species: Cothonaspis retusa Hartig, by monotypy. [Synonymised by<tei:lb/>Weld, 1952: 210.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Tetrahoptra Foerster, 1869: 349. Type-species: Clidotoma heterotoma Thomson, by subsequent designa-<tei:lb/>tion of Ashmead 1903: 62. [Synonymised by Weld, 1952: 207.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Tetratoma Cameron, 1890 preocc. Type-species: Kleidotoma heterotoma Thomson, by subsequent de-<tei:lb/>signation of Rohwer &amp; Pagan, 1917: 376.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Schizosema Kieffer, 1901: 161. Type-species: Cothonaspis emarginatus Hartig, by subsequent designation<tei:lb/>of Ashmead, 1903: 62. [Synonymised by Weld, 1931: 233.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DIAGNOSIS. $ antenna 13-segmented, clavate, with 3-segmented club inpsiloides though a variable number<tei:lb/>of club segments are found within the genus, C? antenna 15-segmented, filiform, segment 3 the largest,<tei:lb/>curved, swollen at apex. Head, viewed frontally, longer than broad, eyes converging towards malar region,<tei:lb/>face smooth, polished, with long sparse hairs either side of clypeus, vertex striate. Pronotal plate produced<tei:lb/>forwards, anterior and posterior parts connected by a medial bridge, foveae on either side of bridge open<tei:lb/>on lateral margins (Fig. 183). Mesoscutum smooth dorsally, without trace of notaulices; mesopleura<tei:lb/>smooth, polished, suture complete; scutellar fovea large, deep, smooth, scutellar disc longitudinally<tei:lb/>striate, scutellar cup long, elliptical, not extending to apex of rounded disc (disc in some species conical or<tei:lb/>beak-shaped). Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of pubescence at base of tergite 2, not complete on<tei:lb/>dorsal surface (Fig. 36). Segment 2 the largest in lateral view, segments 3-5 smaller, not always visible,<tei:lb/>hypopygium with long apical hairs. Wing surface pubescent, radial cell of forewing (Fig. 35), completely<tei:lb/>open on wing margin, apex of wing either incised (Fig. 177) or truncate (Fig. 196). Legs of normal size and<tei:lb/>shape. Colour: antenna yellowish, head, thorax and gaster brownish black, gaster chestnut-red, legs<tei:lb/>yellowish.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISTRIBUTION. Old and New World.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. At present keys to males are difficult to construct. In separating females emphasis has been given<tei:lb/>to the number of antennal club segments and the relative lengths of the basal flagellar segments. In some<tei:lb/>specimens the wings can be brachypterous to almost absent, particularly in the males. K. psiloides has not<tei:lb/>been recognised as occurring in the Afrotropical region.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Kleidotoma arbitra sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 175, 186, 204)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. 9.. Antenna 13-segmented with a distinct 3-segmented club, club segments with rhinaria,<tei:lb/>each wider and longer than preceding flagellar segments, segment 3 subequal in length to 4+5, segments<tei:lb/>4-10 each longer than broad (Fig. 204). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, with a few scattered<tei:lb/>hairs medially, eyes small, round, further apart measured medially than height of an eye, malar groove<tei:lb/>complete, anterior and tentorial pits distinct, occiput smooth, shining, pronotal plate projected forward,<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts connected by a medial bridge, foveae either side of bridge open on lateral<tei:lb/>margins. Pronotum either side of pronotal plate polished; mesopleura smooth, polished, suture distinct,<tei:lb/>mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent, scutellar disc striate on lateral margins, apex of disc<tei:lb/>rounded, scutellar cup long, elliptical, not extending to apex of disc, apex of cup with a large fovea, lateral<tei:lb/>bars of scutellum smooth on dorsal surface, striate laterally, scutellar foveae large, smooth, shallow,<tei:lb/>separated by narrow septum of cup (Fig. 186). Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a dense ring of hairs at base<tei:lb/>of tergite 2, not complete on dorsal surface, apex of tergite 2 smooth, polished, without punctures, tergite 3<tei:lb/>visible laterally (Fig. 175). Wings pubescent on surface, radial cell of forewing completely open on margin,<tei:lb/>vein Rs 2 extended along wing margin, cell triangular, apex of wing arcuate with a long apical hair fringe.<tei:lb/>Colour: segments 1-10 of antenna dark yellow, 11-13 brownish yellow, head, thorax and gaster dark<tei:lb/>chestnut-red, coxae yellow with brownish apices, basal half of femora light brown, apex yellow, tibiae and<tei:lb/>tarsi dark yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype 9. , South Africa: Mossel Bay, Cape Province, x.1921 (R. E. Turner) (BMNH).</tei:p>

         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species resembles psiloides, the Palaearctic species associated with Leptocera manicta<tei:lb/>Richards, but can be separated by the polished occiput.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Kleidotoma bifurcata sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 197, 198, 199, 201)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. 9.. Antenna 13-segmented, clavate with a 6-segmented club, not sharply indicated, club<tei:lb/>segments with rhinaria, segment 3 longer than 4, 4-7 each progressively shorter than each other, club<tei:lb/>segments 8-13 subequal, all longer than segment 7. Head, viewed frontally, with coriaceous sculpture on<tei:lb/>inner orbits, eyes twice as far apart measured medially than height of an eye, striations extending from<tei:lb/>lower margin of eye towards clypeal area, malar grooves obscured by striations, occiput strongly strigose.<tei:lb/>Pronotal plate, viewed dorsally, sculptured on anterior surface, polished on posterior surface, medial<tei:lb/>foveae open on lateral margins (Fig. 199). Pronotum either side of pronotal plate striated. Mesoscutum<tei:lb/>finely coriaceous except for a polished area where parallel lines would be, if present, lateral bars of<tei:lb/>scutellum strongly striated, scutellar disc strongly striate, apex of disc truncated, with a blunt spine on<tei:lb/>either side (Fig. 197), scutellar cup long, elliptical, bulbous apically, with large central fovea, scutellar<tei:lb/>foveae large, deep, polished. Mesopleura smooth, polished, suture pronounced (carina-like on lower<tei:lb/>margin, suture-like on upper margin), with coriaceous sculpture above and below, area below precoxal<tei:lb/>carina pubescent. Lateral margins of propodeum pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a dense ring<tei:lb/>of pubescence, complete on dorsal surface, apex of tergites 2 and 3 with dense punctures, hypopygium<tei:lb/>pronounced (cf. Fig. 201). Wing surface with dotted hair bases, with apical hair fringe, apex of wing<tei:lb/>incised, radial cell of forewing open on margin (Fig. 198). Colour: antenna yellowish brown nasally, club<tei:lb/>blackish brown, head and thorax blackish, gaster blackish brown dorsally, reddish yellow laterally, legs<tei:lb/>yellow brown.<tei:lb/>O" unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype 9., Zaire: Rweru (Vole. Mikeno), 2,400 m (Bambous), 26-27.vii.1934 (G. F. de Witte)<tei:lb/>(MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratype. 1 9. , same data as holotype except 3.vii.l934 (BMNH).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species cannot be confused with any other described in this paper. Apart from the shape of<tei:lb/>the head, the exceedingly distinctive shape of the entire scutellar area (Fig. 197) singles it out from all other<tei:lb/>species.</tei:p>

      </tei:div>

         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 283</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Kleidotoma conica sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 187, 200, 201)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented with the three apical segments forming a distinct club (Fig. 200),<tei:lb/>segments 4-10 each progressively shorter than preceding segment, apical width of each wider than basal<tei:lb/>breadth. Head, viewed frontally, strongly striated in frontal area below ocellus, malar grooves complete,<tei:lb/>clypeus with long scattered hairs, occiput strongly striated. Pronotal plate with lateral fovea open, striated.<tei:lb/>Pronotum and side margins of mesoscutum striated. Scutellar disc tapering to a blunt conical beak at apex,<tei:lb/>striate laterally, reticulate apically, lateral bars of scutellum striated, scutellar foveae large, shallow,<tei:lb/>polished, scutellar cup obscure (Fig. 187). Mesopleural suture distinct, with tuft of pubescence on<tei:lb/>antero ventral cavity. Gaster lenticular in shape, segment 1 obscured by a dense ring of pubescence at base<tei:lb/>of tergite 2, apex of tergite 3 with scattered punctures, 4 punctate, hypopygium short (Fig. 201). Wing<tei:lb/>surface with dotted hair bases, apical margins arcuate, with a hair fringe, radial cell of fore wing open on<tei:lb/>margin, Rs 2 weakly extended along margin. Colour: antenna and legs dark yellow, first antennal segment<tei:lb/>and coxae dark brown, head and thorax black, gaster dark chestnut-red.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: 2.L1952 (H. de Saeger) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Paratype. Zaire: 1 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. A very distinctive species. The very long, truncated, spine-like projection of the scutellar disc<tei:lb/>and the strongly striated upper regions of the face distinguish it from all known species. The radial cell of<tei:lb/>the forewing is typical of Kleidotoma in shape, and the apex of the wing is weakly arcuate.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Kleidotoma distenda sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 188, 199, 202)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented with apical three segments forming a distinct club, segments 3-10<tei:lb/>at least 3 x as long as broad (Fig. 188). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, malar grooves distinct,<tei:lb/>eyes oval, further apart measured medially than height of an eye, occiput very weakly sculptured; pronotal<tei:lb/>plate weakly sculptured with a large fovea on either side of medial bridge, open laterally (cf. Fig. 199).<tei:lb/>Pronotum either side of pronotal plate smooth. Mesopleura smooth, shining, suture distinct; scutellar disc<tei:lb/>with weak broken sculpture to fine striations on lateral margins, apex rounded, weakly sculptured,<tei:lb/>scutellar cup long, narrow, not reaching apex of disc, scutellar foveae large, shining, separated by a wide<tei:lb/>septum at base of cup, lateral bars of scutellum smooth, shining. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a<tei:lb/>moderately hairy ring at base of tergite 2, gaster impunctate. Wings densely pubescent, arcuate apically,<tei:lb/>with fringe of hairs, radial cell of forewing completely open on margin, cell triangular (Fig. 202). Colour:<tei:lb/>segments 1-10 of antenna brownish yellow, 10-13 brown, head dark brown, thorax and gaster chestnut-<tei:lb/>brown, legs yellow, hind coxa with longitudinal sculpture of varying degree.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, South Africa: Mossel Bay, Cape Province, 5-31.vii.1921 (R. E. Turner) (BMNH).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Nigeria: 6 $ (BMNH). South Africa: 11 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 28 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Distinguished from arbitra by antennal segments 4-10, each being twice as long as wide.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Kleidotoma eala sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 193, 194)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented with a distinct 5-segmented club, segment 2 shorter than 3 but<tei:lb/>broader than 3, segment 3 subequal to 4+5 in length, 4 shorter than 5, 5-7 subequal, club segments 9-13<tei:lb/>distinctly wider than segments 3-8 (Fig. 193).          <tei:p>Kleidotoma elongula sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 180, 203, 207)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, the apical 6 segments with rhinaria and forming a weak club,<tei:lb/>segment 2 shorter and broader than 3, 3 longer than 4, 4-7 subequal in length and breadth, cylindrical, 8-13<tei:lb/>each longer than 7, wider medially than at either end (Fig. 203).          <tei:p>Kleidotoma erebus sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 182, 183, 184, 185, 198)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, the apical 3 segments forming a distinct club, segment 3 1-5 x<tei:lb/>length of 4, 4-7 subequal in length, 8-10 almost as wide apically as long (cf. Fig. 182). Head, viewed<tei:lb/>frontally, smooth, polished, eyes oval, as far apart measured medially as height of an eye, inner orbits with<tei:lb/>a carina partially extending from outer area of antennal scrobe, malar grooves percurrent, anterior<tei:lb/>tentorial pits distinct, lower face with sparse setae extending to clypeal region, occiput strongly strigose.<tei:lb/>Pronotal plate projected forward, anterior and posterior parts joined medially by a broad bridge, fovea<tei:lb/>either side of bridge open laterally, with sparse pubescence (Fig. 183). Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of<tei:lb/>hairs at base of tergite 2, tergite 2 the largest in lateral view, 3 and 4 partially visible, apex of tergite 2 and<tei:lb/>visible parts of 3 and 4 punctate, hypopygium not pronounced (Fig. 184). Wing surface pubescent, radial<tei:lb/>cell of forewing open on margin, Rs 2 partially extending along margin, apex of wing incised, with a fringe of<tei:lb/>hairs (Fig. 198); legs of normal proportions.          <tei:p>Kleidotoma favussp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented with a distinct 3-segmented club, club segments with rhinaria,<tei:lb/>wider and longer than preceding flagellar segments, segment 3 as long as 4+5, segments 4-10 as wide<tei:lb/>apically as long, some obconical (Fig. 190).          <tei:p>Kleidotoma fimbriata sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 192, 205, 206)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $.          <tei:p>Kleidotoma montana Kieffer</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Kleidotoma montana Kieffer, 1910c: 107. Holotype $ , RWANDA: Vulkan Karishimbi, 2,700 m, xi. (Exped.<tei:lb/>Herzog Adolf Friedrich zu Mechlenburg).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>The holotype of this species cannot be traced. In his description Kieffer indicates that the club of the</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>286 J. QUINLAN</tei:p>
         <tei:p>antenna is 3-segmented, flagellar segments 4-10 quadrate, head smooth, polished. The scutellar cup is not<tei:lb/>mentioned in the description. In his figure of the whole insect, the wings have an apical fringe of hairs and<tei:lb/>are indented apically. Tergite 2 of the gaster has a ring of hairs at the base and appears complete on the<tei:lb/>dorsal surface; segments 2-5 are visible in lateral view. The drawing does not indicate whether or not any<tei:lb/>segments of the gaster are punctate, and the mesopleural suture is not indicated. The radial cell of the<tei:lb/>forewing is typical for Kleidotoma. A female from Zaire, Ruanda, Contrefort Est. Muhavura, 2,100 m,<tei:lb/>28. i. 1953 (P. Basilewsky), and determined by Benoit as montana, is in MRAC but cannot be accepted as<tei:lb/>this species. From the description and figure I am unable to recognise montana and regard it as incertae<tei:lb/>sedis. The figure indicates that the antennal segments 4-10 are quadrate as in strigosa.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Kleidotoma morsum sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Kleidotoma ventosus sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 181, 182, 186,210,211)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Pronotum on side margins at junction with<tei:lb/>mesoscutum and pronotal plate strongly canaliculate (Fig. 181). Mesopleural suture distinct, with fine<tei:lb/>reticulate sculpture below suture. Mesoscutum smooth, polished; scutellar disc striate, apex of disc<tei:lb/>rounded, reticulate, scutellar cup long, narrow, elliptical, not reaching apex of disc, apex of cup with a<tei:lb/>large fovea, lateral bars of scutellum strongly striate, scutellar foveae large, polished, with narrow septum<tei:lb/>of cup separating them (cf. Fig. 186). Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of<tei:lb/>tergite 2, apex of tergite 2 and visible parts of tergites 3 and 4 punctate. Wing surfaces dotted with hair<tei:lb/>bases, apex of wing sharply incised with apical hair fringe, radial cell of forewing completely open on wing<tei:lb/>margin, vein Rs 2 weakly extending along margin of wing (Fig. 210). Colour: segments 1-10 of antenna dark<tei:lb/>yellow, club segments 11-13 brown, head dark brown-black, thorax black, except for propodeum and<tei:lb/>metapleura which are dark yellow-orange, legs dark yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, South Africa: Port St John, Pondoland, l-5.iv.1923 (R. E. Turner} (BMNH).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Ethiopia: 1 $ (BMNH). South Africa: 3 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 4 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. The length of the antennal segments and the densely strigose occiput distinguish this species.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>NORDLANDERIA gen. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Type-species: Nordlanderia plowa sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DIAGNOSIS. $ antenna 13-segmented, clavate, with 8-9 club segments, cf antenna 15-segmented, filiform,<tei:lb/>segment 3 1-5 x length of 4, weakly curved, swollen distally. Head, viewed frontally, with eyes slightly<tei:lb/>further apart measured medially than height of an eye, inner margins almost parallel, malar space with a<tei:lb/>subocular suture, a few radiating striae on either side, supraclypeal area and anterior region of face with<tei:lb/>short protrusions (Fig. 16). Pronotal plate not protruding, very weakly indicated (Fig. 223), lateral fovea<tei:lb/>either side of median bridge open. Mesoscutum with or without notaulices, if present, very weakly</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 289</tei:p>
         <tei:p>indicated, converging sharply towards scutellum, scutellar foveae obsolete. Mesopleural suture complete,<tei:lb/>area below suture sculptured (Fig. 214). Propodeal carinae bowed, medial area polished, with tufts of<tei:lb/>pubescence on either side. Gaster with segment 1 almost obscured, base of tergite 2 partially enclosing it,<tei:lb/>when visible, short and broad, in the form of a weakly sculptured ring, tergite 2 the largest, occupying<tei:lb/>whole area of gaster viewed laterally, smooth, polished (Fig. 13). Wing surfaces pubescent, with ciliate<tei:lb/>margins, longest at apex, forewing with a closed radial cell although this can appear open in some<tei:lb/>specimens. Legs short, broad, coxae with scattered hairs, femora, tibiae and tarsi moderately pubescent.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISCUSSION. Nordlanderia has close affinities with Microstilba Foerster, but differs in having pronounced<tei:lb/>triangular projections on the face and the notaulices almost absent. In those species where they are present<tei:lb/>they converge posteriorly towards the scutellum at a point almost mid-way between the pronotum and the<tei:lb/>scutellum. As with most eucoilids, the males are difficult to key and separate to species.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISTRIBUTION. Afrotropical Region.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Key to the species of Nordlanderia gen. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, weakly clavate, club 8-segmented, segment 3 1-2 x length of<tei:lb/>segment 4 (Fig. 219). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, frons raised, malar grooves percurrent<tei:lb/>with striations on either side of them, cheeks below grooves extruded to form three tooth-like appendages<tei:lb/>(Fig. 221), eyes weakly converging, frontal area raised. Pronotal plate not projected, anterior and<tei:lb/>posterior parts connected by a medial bridge, with fovea on lateral margins open (cf. Fig. 223).<tei:lb/>Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices very weakly represented, almost absent in some specimens,<tei:lb/>converging sharply towards scutellum, lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar cup slightly longer than<tei:lb/>wide, with a large apical fovea, scutellar disc with widely spaced radiating striae or ridges, scutellar foveae<tei:lb/>aberrant (Fig. 217). Mesopleural suture complete, area below suture coriaceous (cf. Fig. 214); propodeal<tei:lb/>carinae parallel, converging at base towards gaster, lateral margins densely pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster<tei:lb/>not completely visible in lateral view, in the form of a ring, tergites 2-3 visible in lateral view, hypopygium<tei:lb/>pronounced (Fig. 222). Wing surface pubescent, apical margins with a hair fringe, radial cell of forewing<tei:lb/>completely closed on wing margin, longer than wide. Legs normal, moderately pubescent. Colour:<tei:lb/>antenna yellow basally, apical segments darker, legs orange-yellow, head and thorax chestnut-brown,<tei:lb/>gaster lighter.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cf . Antenna 15-segmented; segment 3 longer than 4, curved, swollen distally.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, clavate, with a weakly defined 8-segmented club, segment 3 1-5<tei:lb/>x length of 4 (Fig. 216). Fig. 223), anterior and posterior parts of plate connected by a medial bridge<tei:lb/>with a fovea on either side, open laterally. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, with notaulices weakly<tei:lb/>indicated, converging towards scutellum, sometimes absent in anterior area (Fig. 218); scutellar cup large,<tei:lb/>rim of cup overhanging disc, viewed dorsally, basal half concave, apical half convex (Fig. 218); scutellar<tei:lb/>disc with radiating ridges. Mesopleura with a distinct suture, area below suture coriaceous; propodeal<tei:lb/>carinae bowed medially, inner area smooth, polished, lateral margins with tufts of pubescence. Segment 1<tei:lb/>of gaster obscured, in the form of a narrow ring, tergite 2 the largest, tergites 3 and 4 sometimes visible in<tei:lb/>lateral view . Wing surface pubescent , with apical hair fringe , radial cell of forewing with a closed cell (this is<tei:lb/>sometimes difficult to appreciate).          <tei:p>RHOPTROMERIS Foerster</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris Foerster, 1869: 344. Type-species: Cothonaspis eucera Hartig, 1841, by original designation<tei:lb/>[a junior synonym of Cothonaspis heptoma Hartig, 1840].</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Miomoera Foerster, 1869: 352. Type-species: Miomoera aberrans Foerster, 1869, by subsequent designa-<tei:lb/>tion, Rohwer &amp; Pagan 1917: 371.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Hexamerocera Kieffer, 1901: 175. Type-species: Eucoila rufiventris Giraud, 1860, by subsequent designa-<tei:lb/>tion, Ashmead, 1903: 66.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DIAGNOSIS. $ antenna 13-segmented, with 7-segmented club in type-species (this varies from species to<tei:lb/>species), all club segments bear rhinaria and are generally darker than basal segments of flagellum.<tei:lb/>Segment 3 longer than 4 in type-species, cf antenna 15-segmented, segment 4 longer than 3, curved,<tei:lb/>swollen distally (Fig. 225). Head, viewed frontally, round, slightly longer than wide, supraclypeal area<tei:lb/>raised, malar area with a groove or sulcus extending from bottom of eye to margin of clypeus. Pronotal</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 291</tei:p>
         <tei:p>plate, viewed dorsally, protruding, well developed (Fig. 6), lateral fovea on either side of plate enclosed by<tei:lb/>outer margins of anterior and posterior parts of plate. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent, in<tei:lb/>some species a row of hairs present in their place. Lateral bars of scutellum smooth, scutellar disc<tei:lb/>reticulate-rugose, sometimes with radiating striae from edge of narrow scutellar cup which has one or two<tei:lb/>fovea centrally. Mesopleurae smooth, shiny, mesopleural carina straight, metapleura sometimes with<tei:lb/>weak strigose sculpture ventrally and posteriorly; thorax with short dense pubescence on ventral parts.<tei:lb/>Propodeum with almost parallel carinae, either side of carinae with short dense pubescence. Segment 1 of<tei:lb/>gaster (petiole) visible in part laterally, crenulate (Fig. 249), base of tergite 2 with a ring of dense yellowish<tei:lb/>pubescence, usually complete on dorsal surface though usually incomplete in males (cf. Fig. 36), tergites<tei:lb/>2-5 visible in $, 2-6 in cf in lateral view, hypopygium distinct (Fig. 227). Legs varying in length and<tei:lb/>robustness between species, fore-coxae slender, mid- and hind-coxae swollen, meta-tarsi as long as tarsal<tei:lb/>segments 2-^4 combined, claws simple. Wings densely pubescent on surface, with apical fringe of hairs,<tei:lb/>radial cell of fore wing long, between 2-3 x as long as width (Fig. 224), closed on front margin. Colour:<tei:lb/>antenna yellow basally, club segments darker, head and thorax blackish, gaster dark yellow-brown, legs<tei:lb/>yellowish, coxae and femora darker. Rhoptromeris is related to Trichoplasta and Stentorceps, sharing a<tei:lb/>derived character in the form of the pronotal plate. In all three genera the pronotal plate has the medial<tei:lb/>fovea between the anterior and posterior parts fused laterally. In most other genera the foveae or pits are<tei:lb/>open (Nordlander, 1982). Rhoptromeris has a characteristic radial cell, the veins 2r and Rs (Nordlander,<tei:lb/>19826) and Rs 2 and Rsi (Quinlan, 1979; Eady &amp; Quinlan, 1963) of about equal length. The scutellar cup in<tei:lb/>all three genera is relatively small. In the males the 4th antennal segment is longer than the 3rd and<tei:lb/>modified (Fig. 225).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISTRIBUTION. Old and New World.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris abba sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 232, 240, 243)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 longer than 4, subequal to 4+5, 6 longer than 5, 7<tei:lb/>longer than 6, 8-13 with rhinaria, forming a club (Fig. 240). Head, viewed frontally, with eyes further apart<tei:lb/>measured medially than height ofan eye, face with sparse hairs on lower face, supraclypeal area slightly<tei:lb/>raised, malar grooves distinct, extending from bottom of eye to edge of mandibles, mandibles yellowish<tei:lb/>brown, maxillary palp 4-segmented, labial palp 2-segmented. Pronotal plate with lateral fovea either side<tei:lb/>of medial bridge closed, either side of pronotal plate with sparse pubescence (cf. Fig. 232). Mesoscutum<tei:lb/>smooth, polished, notaulices absent (some specimens with hairs in their place). Scutellar disc rounded at<tei:lb/>apex, lateral margins of disc weakly striated, almost smooth, scutellar cup narrow, minute, scutellar foveae<tei:lb/>shallow, polished, axillae minute, polished. Mesopleural suture distinct, almost parallel with ventral<tei:lb/>margin, metapleura ridged, anteroventral cavity distinct. Propodeal carinae subparallel, densely pubes-<tei:lb/>cent. Segment 1 of gaster as broad as long, base of tergite 2 of gaster with ring of dense pubescence at base,<tei:lb/>not complete on dorsal surface. Tergite 2 the largest in lateral view, apical margin finely punctate, visible<tei:lb/>parts of tergites 3 and 4 densely punctate, hypopygium prominent, ovipositor short. Legs of normal shape,<tei:lb/>coxae robust, mid and hind coxae pubescent apically, tarsi 5-segmented. Forewings relatively narrow,<tei:lb/>surface densely pubescent, apical margin with a fringe of hairs, radial cell of fore wing closed, vein R\ short,<tei:lb/>one-third as long as Rs2, veins M and Rs+M obsolete. Colour: antenna yellowish basally, club segments<tei:lb/>dark, head, thorax and gaster dark chestnut-brown, legs orange-yellow.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>CT. Antenna 15-segmented, 4th segment bent, swollen, outer margin weakly excavate (Fig. 243); gastral<tei:lb/>segments 2-6 visible laterally.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Kenya: Kisumu, nr Lake Victoria, xi.1979 (M. D. Croft) (BMNH).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Kenya: 1 $, 1 C? (BMNH). Zaire: 3 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Closely related to diversa and connatus but distinguished by the punctate gastral segment.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris afer sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 237, 238, 239, 250)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. 9 . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 as long as 4+5, 6 longer than 5, 7 longer than 6, 8-13<tei:lb/>bearing rhinaria, forming a very distinct club (Fig. 237). Head, viewed frontally, with eyes as far apart<tei:lb/>measured medially as height of an eye, supraclypeal area weakly raised, anterior tentorial pits distinct,<tei:lb/>epistomal suture indicated, malar grooves percurrent, mandibles yellowish, maxillary and labial palps<tei:lb/>normal, i.e. 4- and 2-segmented respectively. Pronotal plate with a transverse groove medially between<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts, lateral margins of groove not open (cf. Fig. 250), either side of pronotal plate<tei:lb/>with a tuft of hairs. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent. Apex of scutellum rounded, lateral<tei:lb/>margins of scutellar disc with weak radiating striae, scutellar cup narrow, elliptical (Fig. 238), scutellar<tei:lb/>foveae deep, arched basally, axillae polished. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura with a few aberrant<tei:lb/>wrinkles, anteroventral cavity with a tuft of pubescence. Propodeal carinae subparallel, converging<tei:lb/>basally, pubescent on either side. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of pubescence at base of tergite 2,<tei:lb/>complete on dorsal surface, tergite 2 the largest segment in lateral view, 3 and 4 partially visible, all<tei:lb/>segments smooth, polished, hypopygium short, ovipositor long. Legs normal shape, coxae robust, hind<tei:lb/>coxa pubescent apically, tarsi 5-segmented. Wings densely pubescent, apical margin with a hair fringe,<tei:lb/>radial cell closed, RI short, one-third as long as Rs 2 (Fig. 239), veins M and Rs+M obsolete. Colour:<tei:lb/>antenna yellowish basally, club segments dark, head, thorax and gaster dark brownish yellow, legs<tei:lb/>yellowish.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: N. Lac Kivu, Rwanki, 25.xii.1950 (/. V. Leroy) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Zaire: 4 $, same data as holotype (MRAC). Uganda: 1 $ (BMNH).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is one of two which can be separated from closely related species by the form of the<tei:lb/>pronotal plate. Together with velia, the medial area connecting the anterior and posterior parts is in the<tei:lb/>form of a shallow furrow.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 shorter than 4, 5 longer than 4, 6-13 with rhinaria,<tei:lb/>forming a weak club. Fig. 246), pronotum either side of<tei:lb/>plate with sparse pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent; scutellar disc rounded<tei:lb/>apically, scutellar foveae polished, lateral bars polished, scutellar disc with weak reticulate sculpture on<tei:lb/>lateral margins and long scattered setae, scutellar cup semi-oval, surface with a ring of minute hairs (cf. Fig.<tei:lb/>230). Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura weakly ridged, anteroventral cavity bare. Propodeal carinae<tei:lb/>weakly converging towards metanotal plate, either side of carinae pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster almost<tei:lb/>obscured by a ring of hair at base of tergite 2, sparse on dorsal surface, tergite 2 the largest in lateral view,<tei:lb/>occupying most of visible area, base of tergite 3 visible, impunctate, hypopygium long, narrow, ventral<tei:lb/>spine short. Legs long, thin, with fine pubescence on femora, tibiae and tarsi, tarsi 5-segmented. Forewings<tei:lb/>broad apically, surface densely pubescent, apex with a fringe of hairs, radial cell of forewing longer than<tei:lb/>wide, narrow basally, entirely closed on margin, veins M and Rs+M indicated, not pigmented. Colour:<tei:lb/>antenna yellowish basally, club segments dark, head, thorax and gaster dark chestnut-brown, legs<tei:lb/>yellowish.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris attis sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 longer than 4, 4 longer than 5, 5 and 6 equal in length,<tei:lb/>7-13 forming a distinct club (Fig. 256).          <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 longer than 4, 4 longer than 5, 5 and 6 subequal, club<tei:lb/>segments 7-13 sharply indicated, rhinaria prominent (Fig. 247). Mesoscutum<tei:lb/>smooth, polished, notaulices absent, lateral bars of scutellum smooth, scutellar fovea polished, scutellar<tei:lb/>disc dull with sparse broken radiating sculpture, absent in some specimens, apex rounded, scutellar cup<tei:lb/>broad, elliptical, apex with a small fovea and a ring of smaller fovea around rim, scutellar disc with long<tei:lb/>scattered hairs. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura with weak ridges, anteroventral cavity with a few<tei:lb/>short hairs. Propodeal carinae almost parallel, lateral margins of propodeum pubescent. Wing surface pubescent, with apical fringe of hairs, forewing broad apically, radial cell<tei:lb/>closed on wing margin, longer than broad, broader apically than at base, veins M and Rs+M not indicated.<tei:lb/>Colour: antenna yellow basally, dark apically, head and mesoscutum black, dorsal surface of gaster<tei:lb/>chestnut-brown, pronotum, including plate, mesopleura and lower half of gaster, bright orange-yellow.<tei:lb/>CF unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>REMARKS. A distinctive and easily recognised species by the sharp colour contrasts of the various thoracic<tei:lb/>parts. Very closely related to rufulus but the colour pattern of the antenna of rufulus distinguishes it.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris connatus sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 241, 245)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segments 3 and 4 equal in length, 5 shorter than 4, 6 longer than<tei:lb/>5, 6-7 subequal, 8-13 forming a weak club, swollen medially, bearing rhinaria (Fig. 241). Head, viewed<tei:lb/>frontally, with inner margins of eyes weakly converging, further apart than height of an eye measured<tei:lb/>medially, a row of hairs extending from outer margins of antenna to clypeal area, malar grooves distinct,<tei:lb/>clypeus and surface of mandibles with long scattered hairs, maxillary palp 4-segmented, labial palp<tei:lb/>2-segmented. Pronotal plate with lateral fovea either side of pronotal plate closed. Mesoscutum smooth,<tei:lb/>polished, notaulices absent, lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar fovea semi-circular, sculptured in<tei:lb/>part, scutellar disc weakly conical apically, reticulate-rugose, scutellar cup oval with a transverse fovea<tei:lb/>apically (Fig. 245). Mesopleural suture distinct, bowed medially, metapleura ridged, anteroventral cavity<tei:lb/>obsolete. Propodeal carinae parallel, densely pubescent on lateral margins. Segment 1 of gaster obscured<tei:lb/>by a ring of hairs at base of tergite 2, complete on dorsal surface, segment 1 crescent-shaped in lateral view,<tei:lb/>crenulate, tergite 2 the largest, occupying whole of visible surface in lateral view, impunctate, hypopygium<tei:lb/>weakly produced, ventral spine very short. Legs long, thin, pubescent, coxae elongate, swollen basally,<tei:lb/>femora short, swollen medially, tibiae and tarsi long. Wing surface pubescent with apical hair fringe, radial<tei:lb/>cell of forewing entirely closed on wing margin, veins M and Rs+M indicated by folds. Colour: antenna<tei:lb/>completely yellow, head, thorax and gaster light chestnut-brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: Mabanga, 23.ix.1952 (H. de Saeger) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Zaire: 9 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species could be confused with those species of Trichoplasta with a closed radial cell and<tei:lb/>conical scutellum, but the sculpture of the scutellar disc and the venation distinguish it as a Rhoptromeris.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris crito sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 232, 267, 274)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. Antenna 13-segmented, filiform, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4 longer than 5, 5-8 subequal<tei:lb/>in length, 9-13 shorter than 8, 11-13 white, 5-13 each with rhinaria, forming a very weak club (Fig. 267),</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>298 J. QUINLAN</tei:p>
         <tei:p>segments 3-13 at least 4 x as long as wide. Head, viewed frontally, almost round, slightly longer than<tei:lb/>broad, eyes as far apart as height of an eye measured medially, weakly converging, a few widely spaced<tei:lb/>hairs present between margins of antenna and clypeus, anterior tentorial pits distinct. Pronotal plate<tei:lb/>protruding, medial bridge between anterior and posterior parts distinct, fovea either side enclosed<tei:lb/>laterally, either side of plate with tufts of pubescence (Fig. 232). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, anterior<tei:lb/>median lines and notaulices absent; lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar foveae kidney-shaped,<tei:lb/>scutellar cup a little longer than wide, with a transverse fovea on lower half, basal area of cup pitted,<tei:lb/>scutellar disc reticulate-rugose laterally, weakly ridged apically, rounded (Fig. 274). Mesopleural suture<tei:lb/>complete, metapleura weakly ridged, anteroventral cavity with short abraded hairs; lateral margins of<tei:lb/>propodeum sparsely pubescent, propodeal carinae almost parallel, very weakly bowed medially. Segment<tei:lb/>1 of gaster short, broad, crenulate, obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of tergite 2, complete on<tei:lb/>dorsal surface, tergite 2 the largest in lateral view, tergites 3 and 4 partially visible, gaster impunctate,<tei:lb/>hypopygium not pronounced, with long subapical setae. Wing surface pubescent, with apical fringe of<tei:lb/>hairs, radial cell of forewing long, narrow basally, closed on wing margin, veins Rs+M weakly pigmented<tei:lb/>basally, obsolete towards apex. Legs long, slender, coxae elongate, weakly swollen medially, femora<tei:lb/>weakly swollen basally, tibiae and tarsi long, slender. Colour: antenna dark brown-orange basally, brown<tei:lb/>medially, apical segments light orange-yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED<tei:lb/>Holotype $, Madagascar: Mandrake, ii.1944 (A. Seyrig) (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This is the only species so far recognised which has rhinaria on 9 apical segments of the antenna<tei:lb/>(Fig. 267).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris cubitalis sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 261, 262, 263)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segments 3 and 4 equal in length, 5 shorter than 4, 5-13 subequal<tei:lb/>in length, club segments 7-13 with rhinaria, not sharply delineated. Head, viewed frontally, with inner<tei:lb/>margins of eye further apart measured medially than height of an eye , with a row of scattered hairs between<tei:lb/>outer margins of antenna and clypeus, anterior tentorial pits distinct, with a carina extending to clypeus,<tei:lb/>malar grooves distinct. Pronotal plate with two lateral foveae, one on either side of medial bridge between<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts, closed on lateral margins (Fig. 262), either side of plate with a tuft of<tei:lb/>pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, anterior median lines and notaulices absent though indica-<tei:lb/>tions present below surface; lateral bars smooth, polished, scutellar fovea deep, scutellar disc with ridges<tei:lb/>radiating out from narrow elliptical scutellar cup (Fig. 263) , cup with an apical fovea, disc truncate apically.<tei:lb/>Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura polished, anteroventral cavity with a tuft of pubescence, area<tei:lb/>close to propodeum densely pubescent. Propodeal carinae parallel, pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster in the<tei:lb/>form of a crenulate ring, partially hidden by a dense ring of pubescence at base of tergite 2, complete on<tei:lb/>dorsal surface, tergites 2-4 visible in lateral view, impunctate, tergite 2 the largest, hypopygium not<tei:lb/>pronounced, ventral spine long. Legs long, slender, coxae weakly swollen basally, femora strongly swollen<tei:lb/>basally, tibiae and tarsi long, slender, coxae and femora with sparse hairs, femora tibiae and tarsi<tei:lb/>pubescent. Wing surface pubescent, with apical hair fringe, fore wings broad apically with radial cell closed<tei:lb/>on wing margin (Fig. 261), short, little longer than broad, veins M and Rs+M weakly pigmented basally,<tei:lb/>obsolete apically. Colour: antenna dark orange-yellow, head dark brown, thorax and gaster light brown,<tei:lb/>legs yellow.<tei:lb/>cT unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: Secteur Tahisberimu, Talya Nerd, 23.iii.1954 (P. Vanschuythbroeck &amp; M. Synave)<tei:lb/>(MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratype. Zaire: 1 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is close to thales but the length of antennal segment 3 is equal to 4, the lateral<tei:lb/>margins of the scutellar disc are polished and the radial cell is shorter than in thales.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 299</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris diversa sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 242, 244, 246)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 as long as 4-1-5,5 shorter than 6, 8-13 forming a distinct<tei:lb/>club, rhinaria prominent (Fig. 242). Head, viewed frontally, with eyes further apart measured medially,<tei:lb/>than height of an eye, with scattered hairs in a line extending from outer edge of antennal socket to clypeal<tei:lb/>area, anterior tentorial pits distinct, malar grooves distinct, clypeus and mandibular area with long<tei:lb/>scattered hairs. Pronotal plate with two fovea, one either side of medial bridge between anterior and<tei:lb/>posterior parts, closed on lateral margins (cf. Fig. 246), either side of plate pubescent. Mesoscutum<tei:lb/>smooth, polished, notaulices absent, lateral bars of scutellum broad basally, smooth, polished, scutellar<tei:lb/>foveae half-moon-shaped, polished, scutellar disc weakly conical apically, surface rugose, scutellar cup<tei:lb/>semi-oval, apex with a transverse fovea, base pitted (Fig. 244). Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura<tei:lb/>ridged, anteroventral cavity polished. Propodeal carinae parallel, sides of propodeum weakly pubescent.<tei:lb/>Segment 1 of gaster in the form of a crenulate ring, partially hidden by ring of pubescence at base of tergite<tei:lb/>2, tergite 2 the largest in lateral view, segment 3 visible, gaster impunctate, hyopygium small, ovipositor<tei:lb/>short. Legs short, robust, coxae and femora weakly swollen basally, tibiae stout apically, tarsi short, stout,<tei:lb/>coxae sparsely pubescent, tibiae and tarsi moderately pubescent. Wing surface pubescent, apical margin<tei:lb/>with a fringe of hairs , f orewing narrow , radial cell closed on margin , longer than broad , veins M and Rs+M<tei:lb/>not indicated. Colour: antenna yellow basally, brownish apically, head, thorax and gaster light orange-<tei:lb/>brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, South Africa: Cape Province, Somerset East, 23-3 l.xii. 1930 (R. E. Turner) (BMNH).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratypes. South Africa: 1 &lt;j&gt;, same data as holotype (BMNH). Uganda: 1 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 7 $<tei:lb/>(MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. The absence of punctures on the gaster and the weakly conical scutellum separate this species<tei:lb/>from abba, and the lengths of the individual club segments separate it from connatus, see key.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris enna sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 246, 259)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 as long as 4+5, 4-6 subquadrate, 7-13 forming a<tei:lb/>distinct club (Fig. 259). Face, viewed frontally, with eyes as far apart as height of an eye measured medially,<tei:lb/>face with a row of scattered hairs extending from outer margins of antenna to clypeus, malar grooves<tei:lb/>distinct, lower face with scattered hairs. Pronotal plate with two foveae, one on each side of medial bridge<tei:lb/>between anterior and posterior parts of plate, bridge narrow (cf. Fig. 246) , fovea closed on lateral margins.<tei:lb/>Pronotum either side of pronotal plate with tufts of pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, anterior<tei:lb/>median lines and notaulices absent; lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar disc reticulate-rugose-<tei:lb/>coriaceous, rounded apically, scutellar cup narrow, elliptical, apex with a large transverse fovea, basal half<tei:lb/>sculptured, rim of cup broad. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura with a weak ridge on margins closest<tei:lb/>to propodeum, anteroventral cavity with a tuft of pubescence. Propodeal carinae weakly bowed medially,<tei:lb/>either side of propodeum pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of<tei:lb/>tergite 2, tergite 2 the largest in lateral view, 3-4 partially visible, apex of tergite 2 and visible parts of 3 and<tei:lb/>4 punctate, hypopygium prominent, ventral spine short, subbasal hairs present. Legs normally prop-<tei:lb/>ortioned, mid and hind coxae swollen basally, femora swollen basally and medially, tibiae widest apically,<tei:lb/>tarsi long, slender, femora, tibiae and tarsi pubescent. Wing surface pubescent, with apical hair fringe,<tei:lb/>radial cell of forewings closed, longer than broad, veins M and Rs+M not pigmented, folds indicated.<tei:lb/>Colour: antenna yellowish basally, darker apically, head, thorax and gaster dark chestnut-brown, legs<tei:lb/>yellow.</tei:p>
