         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is closely related to punctata but is distinguished by antennal segments 4-6 being<tei:lb/>subquadrate and by the sculpture of the scutellar disc.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris equalis sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 253, 290)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segments 3-6 subequal in length, 7-13 with rhinaria, forming a<tei:lb/>distinctive club, each swollen medially (Fig. 253). Head, viewed frontally, with eyes converging weakly,<tei:lb/>narrowest at a point between inner margins of eyes, and less than height of an eye, with a row of scattered<tei:lb/>hairs between outer antennal sockets and epistomal suture, anteroventral pits and malar grooves distinct,<tei:lb/>clypeus and mandibular area with sparse pubescence. Pronotal plate with a transverse groove between<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts of plate, medial bridge not indicated (Fig. 290), lateral margins of groove<tei:lb/>closed. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent, lateral bars of scutellum small, polished,<tei:lb/>scutellar fovea oval, polished; scutellar disc with radiating ridges, apex rounded. Mesopleural suture<tei:lb/>distinct, metapleural ridges on ventral margins, anteroventral cavity bare. Propodeal carinae bowed<tei:lb/>medially, densely pubescent on lateral margins. Segment 1 of gaster not visible, obscured by a dense ring of<tei:lb/>hairs at base of tergite 2, tergite 2 the largest, 3 and 4 partially visible in lateral view, gaster impunctate,<tei:lb/>hypopygium small, ventral spine not exposed. Legs normal, coxae elongate, swollen basally, femora<tei:lb/>swollen basally, tibiae swollen apically, tarsi slender. Wings long, narrow, surfaces pubescent, margins<tei:lb/>with a fringe of hairs, radial cell of forewing closed on margin, slightly longer than broad, veins M and<tei:lb/>Rs+M not pigmented, only folds indicated. Colour: antenna orange-yellow basally, apical segments<tei:lb/>darker, head and thorax dark chestnut-brown, gaster chestnut-red, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Cameroun: Nkoemvon, 29.vii.1979 (D. Jackson) (BMNH).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Cameroun: 2 $, same data as holotype (BMNH). Zaire: 3 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Distinguished frompersius by the distinct club with pronounced rhinaria on each segment.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris hebe sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Fig. 250)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segments 3+4 subequal, 5 shorter than 4, 6-13 forming a weak<tei:lb/>club, each segment with rhinaria. Head, viewed frontally, with inner margins of eyes further apart than<tei:lb/>height of an eye measured medially, face with scattered hairs, anterior tentorial pits distinct, malar grooves<tei:lb/>distinct, clypeus and mandibles sparsely pubescent. Pronotal plate with a transverse groove medially<tei:lb/>between anterior and posterior parts of plate, medial bridge between both parts not apparent (cf. Fig. 250),<tei:lb/>groove closed on lateral margins, either side of plate with tufts of pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth,<tei:lb/>polished, scutellar foveae half-moon-shaped, polished; lateral bars of scutellum narrow, polished;<tei:lb/>scutellar disc rounded apically, lateral surfaces smooth, with radiating ridges apically. Mesopleural suture<tei:lb/>distinct, metapleura weakly ridged, anteroventral cavity with a minute tuft of hair. Propodeal carinae<tei:lb/>parallel, almost as far apart as their length, with tufts of pubescence on outer margins. Segment 1 of gaster<tei:lb/>crescent-shaped, viewed laterally, crenulate, partially obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of<tei:lb/>tergite 2, complete on dorsal surface, tergite 2 the largest, 3 and 4 partially visible in lateral view, gaster<tei:lb/>impunctate, hypopygium broad basally, ventral spine short, with sparse subbasal hairs. Legs normal, mid<tei:lb/>and hind coxae swollen, hind coxae elongate, femora swollen basally, tibiae broader apically, all<tei:lb/>pubescent, tarsi 5-segmented. Wings narrow, surfaces pubescent, apical margins with a fringe of hairs,<tei:lb/>radial cell of forewing closed on margin, longer than broad, veins M and Rs+M not pigmented, weakly<tei:lb/>indicated by folds. Colour: antenna yellowish basally, club segments darker, head, thorax and gaster<tei:lb/>yellowish brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: 18.ix.1952 (H. deSaeger) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. Zaire: 10 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris heptoma (Hartig)</tei:p>

         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 301</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cothonaspis eucerus Hartig, 1841: 357. Holotype $, GERMANY (ZSBS). [Synonomy by Cameron, 1890:<tei:lb/>206; Hellen, 1960: 8.]</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 longer than 4, 4 longer than 5, 5 and 6 subequal in<tei:lb/>length, 7-13 forming a distinct club (Fig. 7). Face, viewed frontally, with eyes further apart than height of<tei:lb/>an eye measured medially, face with a row of hairs extending from outer margins of antennal sockets to<tei:lb/>clypeus, malar grooves distinct, supraclypeal area and mandibular area with sparse scattered hairs.<tei:lb/>Pronotal plate with two fovea, one each side of medial bridge between anterior and posterior parts of plate,<tei:lb/>either side of plate with a tuft of pubescence on lateral margins of pronotum. Mesoscutum smooth,<tei:lb/>polished, notaulices absent, sparse hairs along margin with pronotum; lateral bars of scutellum polished,<tei:lb/>scutellar foveae almost round, scutellar disc punctate-reticulate to almost smooth, rounded apically,<tei:lb/>scutellar cup longer than broad, elliptical (Fig. 226). Mesopleural suture strongly bowed medially,<tei:lb/>metapleura mainly smooth with a few ridges, anteroventral cavity with a tuft of hairs. Propodeal carinae<tei:lb/>bowed medially, pubescent laterally. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of<tei:lb/>tergite 2, only a crescent-shape apparent, tergites 2-4 visible in lateral view, impunctate, hypopygium not<tei:lb/>prominent, ventral spine short, subbasal hairs present. Legs normal, mid and hind coxae swollen, slender,<tei:lb/>with tufts of hair, femora swollen basally, tibiae widest apically, slender, all segments of legs weakly<tei:lb/>pubescent. Wing surfaces pubescent, margins with apical hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on<tei:lb/>margin, Rs 2 and Rs^ of equal length, M and Rs+M indicated (Fig. 224). Colour: antenna yellow basally,<tei:lb/>dark apically, head, thorax and gaster shining black-brown, legs yellowish.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cf . Antenna 15-segmented, segment 3 curved on outer margin, weakly swollen apically, segment 4 twice<tei:lb/>length of 3, curved, swollen, 5-15 filiform (Fig. 225).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED<tei:lb/>South Africa: 3 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 3 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. R. heptoma is a parasite of Chloropidae (Nordlander, 1978). The specimens from South Africa<tei:lb/>and Zaire are very similar to European heptoma but differ very slightly in colour and the form of the<tei:lb/>pronotal plate.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segments 3 and 4 subequal in length, 5 shorter than 4, 6-13<tei:lb/>forming a club, rhinaria prominent.          <tei:p>Rhoptromeris oeta sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 230, 231, 250)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4 longer than 5, 5-6 subequal in length,<tei:lb/>7-13 weakly swollen medially, with rhinaria, the whole filiform, club segments not sharply defined (Fig.<tei:lb/>230).          <tei:p>Rhoptromeris pagasasp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 303</tei:p>
         <tei:p>in length, with rhinaria, not forming a distinct clavate shape (Fig. 278). Face, viewed frontally, with eyes<tei:lb/>measured medially as close together as height of an eye, face with sparse scattered hairs, malar groove<tei:lb/>distinct, mandibular area with sparse hairs. Pronotal plate with a transverse furrow between anterior and<tei:lb/>posterior parts, furrow closed on lateral margins (Fig. 233); either side of plate with tufts of pubescence.<tei:lb/>Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent; lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar fovea<tei:lb/>kidney-shaped, polished; scutellar disc with aberrant sculpture laterally, almost smooth, rugose apically,<tei:lb/>scutellar cup elongate, rim thick (cf. Fig. 231), apex of disc rounded. Mesopleural suture distinct,<tei:lb/>metapleura smooth, anteroventral cavity with a tuft of hairs. Propodeal carinae almost parallel, weakly<tei:lb/>bowed apically, lateral margins pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster, viewed laterally, crescent-shaped,<tei:lb/>partially obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of tergite 2, tergites 2-4 visible in lateral view,<tei:lb/>tergite 2 the largest, occupying almost whole visible area, segments 3 and 4 only partially visible, gaster<tei:lb/>impunctate, hypopygium pronounced, visible part of ventral spine as long as base of hypopygium. Legs<tei:lb/>normal, coxae longer than broad, swollen basally, femora swollen from base for two-thirds of length, tibiae<tei:lb/>widest apically, meta-tarsi slender, longer than remaining combined tarsal segments. Wing surfaces<tei:lb/>pubescent, apical margins with a fringe of hairs, radial cell closed on margin, longer than broad, veins M<tei:lb/>and Rs+M not indicated. Colour: antenna yellow basally, 8 apical segments darker than basal segments,<tei:lb/>head, thorax and gaster orange-brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is closely related to temesa but can be separated by the relative lengths of antennal<tei:lb/>segments 3 and 4 and the form of the pronotal plate.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptr omens pallidussp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 246, 264)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 as long as 4+5, 5 and 6 subequal in length, 7-13<tei:lb/>forming a distinct club. Head, viewed frontally, with eyes further apart measured medially than height of<tei:lb/>eye, eyes diverging posteriorly, face with sparse hairs extending from base of antennal sockets to clypeal<tei:lb/>area, malar grooves distinct, anterior tentorial pits not clearly defined, apex of clypeus with long scattered<tei:lb/>hairs extending over mandibles. Pronotal plate with two medial fovea between anterior and posterior<tei:lb/>parts, separated by a broad medial bridge, closed on lateral margins (cf. Fig. 246). Mesoscutum smooth,<tei:lb/>polished, notaulices absent; lateral bars of scutellum polished basally, broader than long, scutellar fovea<tei:lb/>polished, scutellar disc rounded apically, surface with sparse weak radiating striae (very weak in some<tei:lb/>specimens); scutellar cup raised, long, narrow, rim almost as wide as inner surface of cup. Mesopleural<tei:lb/>suture distinct, metapleura with weak ridges, anteroventral cavity with minute hairs. Propodeal carinae<tei:lb/>converging basally, weakly bowed apically, propodeum pubescent medially, with tufts of pubescence on<tei:lb/>lateral margins. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of hairs at base of tergite 2, tergite 2 the largest in<tei:lb/>lateral view, tergites 3-4 partially visible, apex of 2 and visible parts of 3 and 4 finely punctate, hypopygium<tei:lb/>broad, with subbasal hairs, ventral spine short. Legs normal, mid and hind coxae elongate, swollen basally,<tei:lb/>shorter than the femora, femora widest apically, shorter than tarsis. Wing surfaces pubescent, with a long<tei:lb/>apical fringe of hairs on apical margins, radial cell of forewing closed on margin, veins strongly pigmented,<tei:lb/>M and Rs+M absent. Colour: antenna and legs pale yellow, head, thorax and gaster light orange-yellow (in<tei:lb/>some specimens apical segments of antenna darker than basal segments).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cf . Antenna 15-segmented, segment 3 shorter than each of following segments, 4th curved and swollen<tei:lb/>apically (Fig. 264).</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris persius sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 longer than 4, 4-6 subequal in length, 7-13 forming a<tei:lb/>weak club, the segments swollen medially (Fig. 251). Fig. 250).<tei:lb/>Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent; lateral bars of scutellum polished basally, weakly<tei:lb/>striated laterally, scutellar fovea polished, kidney-shaped, scutellar disc with radiating striae, apex<tei:lb/>rounded, scutellar cup longer than broad, polished, rim light-coloured, apex of cup with a fovea.<tei:lb/>Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura weakly ridged, anteroventral cavity with a distinct tuft of hairs.<tei:lb/>Propodeal carinae weakly bowed apically, lateral margins pubescent. Legs normal,<tei:lb/>mid and hind coxae swollen basally, longer than broad, trochanters long, femora swollen basally, tibiae<tei:lb/>widest at apex. Wing surfaces pubescent, margins with a fringe of hairs, radial cell of forewing closed on<tei:lb/>margin, long, narrow (Fig. 252), veins M and Rs+M absent. Colour: antenna orange-yellow basally,<tei:lb/>brownish apically, head and thorax reddish brown, gaster orange-brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>C? unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris punctata sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 239, 246, 248)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 as long as 4+5, segment 4 longer than 5, each more<tei:lb/>than twice as long as wide, 7-13 forming a distinct club (Fig. 248). Face, viewed frontally, with eyes further<tei:lb/>apart than height of an eye measured medially, face with a row of hairs extending from outer margins of<tei:lb/>antenna to clypeus, malar grooves distinct, lower face with scattered hairs. Pronotal plate with two fovea,<tei:lb/>one either side of medial bridge between anterior and posterior parts of plate , closed on lateral margins (cf.<tei:lb/>Fig. 246). Pronotum either side of plate with sparse hairs. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices<tei:lb/>absent, a row of scattered hairs in their place, lateral bars of scutellum smooth, polished, scutellar disc<tei:lb/>polished, rounded apically, cup narrow, elliptical. Mesopleural suture weak though complete, metapleura<tei:lb/>with a few weak impressions, anteroventral cavity with a tuft of hairs. Propodeal carinae parallel,<tei:lb/>pubescent on lateral margins. Segment 1 of gaster in the form of a short crenulate ring, tergite 2 the largest,<tei:lb/>with a ring of pubescence at base, not complete on dorsal surface, tergites 2-4 of gaster visible in lateral<tei:lb/>view, visible parts of 3 and 4 punctate, hypopygium weakly protruding, ventral spine short. Legs of normal<tei:lb/>proportions, coxae weakly swollen basally, femora medially swollen, tibiae broad apically, tarsi short,<tei:lb/>equal in length to tibiae; femora, tibiae and tarsi with sparse pubescence. Wing surface pubescent, with a<tei:lb/>long apical fringe of hairs on frontal and apical margins, radial cell of forewing closed on margin, veins<tei:lb/>thick, cell small (cf. Fig. 239), veins M and Rs+M not indicated. Colour: antenna yellowish, apical<tei:lb/>segments darker, head, thorax and gaster chestnut-red-brown, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 307</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Head , viewed frontally , with eyes as far apart measured medially as the height of an eye , face with scattered<tei:lb/>hairs, prominent around malar grooves, clypeus and mandibles. Pronotal plate with two fovea separated<tei:lb/>by a medial bridge between anterior and posterior parts, with a tuft of pubescence on either side (cf. Fig.<tei:lb/>275). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, lateral bars polished, scutellar fovea polished, weakly sculptured;<tei:lb/>scutellar disc with radiating and ridged sculpture apically, apex rounded; scutellar cup large, elongate,<tei:lb/>broad, apex with a transverse fovea, basal half polished, with weak sculpture, rim of disc with a few long<tei:lb/>setae (Fig. 283). Mesopleural suture distinct, straight, metapleura polished on upper margins, ridged<tei:lb/>apically, anteroventral cavity with minute hairs. Propodeal carinae parallel, thick, pubescent laterally.<tei:lb/>Segment 1 of gaster completely hidden, ring of hairs at base of tergite 2 short and thick, tergite 2 the largest<tei:lb/>in lateral view, punctate, segments 3 and 4 not visible, hypopygium short, squarish apically, ventral spine<tei:lb/>short. Legs slender, normal shape, sparsely pubescent. Wing surfaces pubescent, apical margins with a<tei:lb/>fringe of hairs. Forewing broad apically, radial cell closed on margin, longer than broad (Fig. 284), veins M<tei:lb/>and Rs+M not pigmented, visible as folds. Colour: antenna orange-brown basally , apical segments darker,<tei:lb/>head blackish red, thorax and gaster chestnut-red, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED<tei:lb/>Holotype $, Zaire: N. Lac Kivu, Rwanki, 15.ii.1952 (J. V. Leroy) (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. A distinctive species which can be separated from rutshuris by the strong radiating sculpture of<tei:lb/>the scutellar disc and the broad median bridge on the pronotal plate.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris thalessp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 228, 265, 266)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4 and 5 equal in length, 6 shorter than 5,<tei:lb/>7-13 with rhinaria, each segment wider apically than basally (Fig. 266). Face, viewed frontally, with eyes as<tei:lb/>close together measured medially as height of an eye, face with sparse hairs between outer margins of<tei:lb/>antennal sockets and clypeal area, malar grooves and anterior tentorial pits distinct. Pronotal plate with<tei:lb/>two fovea, one either side of medial bridge between anterior and posterior parts, lateral margins of fovea<tei:lb/>closed (cf. Fig. 228), either side of plate with sparse hairs. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices<tei:lb/>absent; lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar fovea polished, kidney-shaped, wider than long;<tei:lb/>scutellar disc rounded apically, lateral margins with widely spaced radiating sculpture, apical surface the<tei:lb/>same; scutellar cup long, narrow, with apical fovea. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura weakly<tei:lb/>ridged, anteroventral cavity with minute hairs. Propodeal carinae bowed medially, propodeum pubescent<tei:lb/>on dorsal and lateral surfaces. Segment 1 of gaster in the form of a crenulate ring, visible part in the form of<tei:lb/>a crescent, tergite 2 the largest, base with a dense ring of hairs, tergites 3 and 4 partially visible, gaster<tei:lb/>impunctate, hypopygium pronounced, ventral spine short. Legs slender, mid and hind coxae elongate,<tei:lb/>swollen basally, femora swollen basally, tibiae widest apically, longer than femora, slightly longer than<tei:lb/>tarsi. Wing surfaces pubescent, with apical fringe of hairs, forewing narrow, radial cell elongate, narrow<tei:lb/>basally, weakly rounded (Fig. 265), closed on margin, veins M and Rs+M not indicated, folds only present.<tei:lb/>Colour: antenna yellow basally, apical 7 segments darker, head, thorax and gaster blackish brown, legs<tei:lb/>yellow.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Zaire: Kivu, Rutshuru, Lubiriz, 1,285 m, 13.vii.1935 (G. F. de Witte) (MRAC).<tei:lb/>Paratypes. South Africa: 2 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 8 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species can be confused with those having a thread-like antenna, but the length to breadth<tei:lb/>ratios of the segments are not as great and the club segments are discernible not only by the rhinaria being<tei:lb/>distinct but by the very weak but apparent clavate form of each segment (Fig. 266).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Rhoptromeris velia sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Fig. 250)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. 9- Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 very slightly shorter than 4, almost equal in length, 5<tei:lb/>shorter than 4, equal in length to 6, 8-13 subequal in length, swollen medially, with distinct rhinaria.       </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>308 J. QUINLAN</tei:p>
         <tei:p>plate, closed on lateral margins (cf. Fig. 250). Pronotum either side of plate pubescent. Mesoscutum<tei:lb/>smooth, polished, notaulices absent. Scutellar fovea transversely long, kidney-shaped, deep, polished;<tei:lb/>lateral bars of scutellum polished; scutellar disc smooth laterally to weakly reticulate with radiating broken<tei:lb/>rugose sculpture apically, scutellar cup almost oval, with a wide rim, apex with a small semi-circular fovea,<tei:lb/>inner margin of rim with a few small fovea or pits. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura weakly ridged,<tei:lb/>anteroventral cavity bare. Propodeal carinae subparallel, weakly converging apically, lateral margins of<tei:lb/>propodeum with dense tufts of pubescence .          <tei:p>Rhoptromeris zetes sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, segments 3-6 subequal in length, 7-13 forming a weak club, each<tei:lb/>club segment with rhinaria and clearly wider apically than basally. Face, viewed frontally, with eyes weakly<tei:lb/>converging, further apart measured medially than height of an eye, scattered hairs extending from outer<tei:lb/>margins of antennal sockets to clypeus. Pronotal plate with a transverse groove between anterior and<tei:lb/>posterior parts, closed on lateral margins (Fig. 250), lateral margins of pronotum with tufts of pubescence<tei:lb/>either side of pronotal plate. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent; lateral bars of scutellum<tei:lb/>polished, scutellar disc smooth laterally, ridged apically, apical margin of disc rounded; scutellar cup<tei:lb/>elongate, narrow apically, rim of cup paler than inner surface, apex with minute fovea. Propodeal carinae<tei:lb/>parallel, lateral margins of propodeum pubescent. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura with complete<tei:lb/>transverse ridges, anteroventral cavity with a tuft of short hairs. Propodeal carinae subparallel, weakly<tei:lb/>bowed apically, strongly pubescent laterally. Segment 1 of gaster in the form of a crenulate ring, partially<tei:lb/>obscured by a ring of short hairs at base of tergite 2, tergite 2 the largest in lateral view, punctate apically,<tei:lb/>visible parts of tergites 3 and 4 punctate, hypopygium small. Ventral spine short (Fig. 249). Legs normal,<tei:lb/>mid and hind coxae elongate, coxae swollen basally, shorter than femora, femora widest apically, tarsi<tei:lb/>longer than tibiae. Wing surfaces pubescent, apical margin with a hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed,<tei:lb/>veins M and Rs+M weakly indicated by pigmentation. Colour: antenna yellow basally, 7-11 brownish,<tei:lb/>12-13 light yellow, almost white, head and thorax chestnut-brown, gaster dark orange- yellow, legs yellow.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>STENTORCEPS Quinlan</tei:p>

Supraclypeal area of face with a large<tei:lb/>protrusion shaped like the mouth of a trumpet, slightly narrower at its base (Fig. 32), mandibles very long,<tei:lb/>apically truncate, with scissors-like action (Fig. 289), clypeus long, narrow, with a few sparse setae (Fig.<tei:lb/>289). Pronotal plate projected forward, posterior and anterior parts separated medially by a transverse<tei:lb/>ridge with two shallow foveae, not open on lateral margins. Segments 1-4 of gaster visible in $ , and 1-6 in<tei:lb/>C? , apical segments punctate (Fig. 286).</tei:p>

         <tei:p>TRICHOPLASTA Benoit</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Trichoplasta Benoit, 1956: 537. Type-species: Trichoplasta basilewskyi Benoit, by original designation and<tei:lb/>monotypy.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DIAGNOSIS. $ antenna 13-segmented, pubescent, with a 6-9-segmented club usually darker than basal<tei:lb/>flagellar segments, segment 3 generally shorter than 4, C? antenna 15-segmented, segment 3 shorter than<tei:lb/>following segments, segment 4 elongate, sometimes swollen distally (Fig. 308). Head, viewed frontally,<tei:lb/>rounded, frons raised, malar space with a subocular suture with carinae and weak striations on lower side.<tei:lb/>Pronotal plate similar to that of Rhoptromeris ', i.e. lateral fovea either side of median bridge between<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts closed (Fig. 300), medial bridge generally narrow. Scutellar disc produced,<tei:lb/>overhanging propodeum, scutellar cup with a large fovea on lower half. Segment 1 of gaster visible, not<tei:lb/>obscured by dense woolly ring of pubescence at base of tergite 2, apical segments usually punctate. Wing<tei:lb/>surfaces densely pubescent, usually narrow, hair margins along apical margins long, radial cell of forewing<tei:lb/>open or closed on margin, not deep. Segment 1 of gaster visible, not widened at either end, tergite 2 with a<tei:lb/>dense hairy ring basally, apical segments of gaster generally with dense puncturation (Fig. 334). Legs<tei:lb/>usually slender.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DISTRIBUTION</tei:p>
         <tei:p>World- wide except Neotropical region.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This genus is closely related to Rhoptromeris and Stentorceps by the form of the pronotal plate<tei:lb/>being common to all three genera, but is separated by the apomorphic scutellar prolongation.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Trichoplasta bicolorsp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 337, 338, 344)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, very weakly subclavate, the 7-segmented club not sharply<tei:lb/>defined (Fig. 337), rhinaria visible on all club segments, each club segment weakly swollen medially. Head,<tei:lb/>viewed frontally, smooth, polished, with long sparse hairs, antennal sockets pronounced, anterior tentorial<tei:lb/>pits distinct, subocular sulcus distinct, occipital carina weak. Pronotal plate rounded laterally and dorsally<tei:lb/>on posterior margins, anterior rounded on lateral margin, fovea either side of medial bridge closed on<tei:lb/>lateral margins (cf. Fig. 344), either side of plate with tufts of whitish pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth,<tei:lb/>polished, lateral bars of scutellum polished dorsally, scutellar fovea shallow, polished; scutellar disc<tei:lb/>reticulate-rugose, tapering almost to a point (similar to a beak), scutellar cup small, elliptical, with a pale<tei:lb/>rim, sculptured basally with a large apical fovea on apical third (Fig. 338). Lateral margins of pronotum,<tei:lb/>mesopleura and metapleura smooth, polished, mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura ridged, pubescent<tei:lb/>adjacent to hind coxa, nucha ridged, pubescent. Propodeal carinae weakly bowed, obscured by pubesc-<tei:lb/>ence. Segment 1 of gaster completely obscured by a dense woolly ring of hairs at base of tergite 2,<tei:lb/>incomplete on dorsal surface, tergite 2 impunctate, remaining tergites not visible in lateral or dorsal view,<tei:lb/>hypopygium clearly visible. Legs long, slender, coxae elongate, coxae, femora and tibiae pubescent. Wing<tei:lb/>surface pubescent, with apical hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on wing margin, venation pallid,<tei:lb/>vein M (cubitus) not indicated. Colour: head and thorax brownish, gaster chestnut-red, legs orange-<tei:lb/>yellow, antenna yellow basally, dark apically.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is distinguished by the 7-segmented club (see key).</tei:p>

         <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 313</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Trichoplasta brevispina (Masner)<tei:lb/>(Figs 318, 320)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Odonteucoila brevispina Masner, 1960: 357. Holotype $, KENYA (MRAC) [examined].<tei:lb/>Trichoplasta brevispina (Masner) Nordlander, 19820: 273.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, with a distinct 5-segmented club, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4<tei:lb/>longer than 5, 5 shorter than 6, 5-12 subequal in length, 13 as long as 3, apical 5 segments distinctly broader<tei:lb/>than preceding segments. Head, viewed frontally, with sparse scattered hairs, antennal sockets pro-<tei:lb/>nounced, viewed dorsally, subocular sulcus and malar suture distinct, with striae on either side, occipital<tei:lb/>carinae pronounced dorsally. Pronotal plate rounded posteriorly, viewed frontodorsally, anterior margins<tei:lb/>angled laterally, medial bridge between anterior and posterior parts separated by a narrow bridge, fovea<tei:lb/>either side of bridge closed on lateral margins. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, with widely scattered hairs,<tei:lb/>notaulices absent; lateral bars of scutellum polished, weakly sculptured; scutellar disc with radiating,<tei:lb/>ridged rugose sculpture, apex conical, not elongated to form a beak-like projection (Fig. 320), sparse hairs<tei:lb/>present; scutellar cup small, elliptical, rim pronounced, inner surface depressed, sculptured with a small<tei:lb/>apical fovea. Pro no turn smooth, polished, with pubescence either side of pronotal plate; mesopleural<tei:lb/>suture distinct, metapleura ridged basally with tufts of hair either side of propodeum. Propodeal carinae<tei:lb/>parallel , nucha longitudinally ridged , pubescent . Segment 1 of gaster crenulate , base of tergite 2 with a ring<tei:lb/>of hairs, incomplete on dorsal surface, apex of tergite 2 impunctate, segments 3 and 4 not visible,<tei:lb/>hypopygium weakly projecting. Legs long, slender, coxae and femora with long sparse hairs. Wings<tei:lb/>narrow, surfaces pubescent, with apical hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on margin (Fig. 318),<tei:lb/>venation very pallid, vein M (cubitus) indicated, not pigmented. Colour: head and thorax brownish black,<tei:lb/>gaster chestnut-red, legs yellowish, coxa yellowish brown, antenna yellowish, club segments yellowish<tei:lb/>brown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Trichoplasta conica sp. n.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented with a distinct, moniliform, 6-segmented club, segment 3 as long<tei:lb/>as 4+5, 4 longer than 5, 5 shorter than 6, club segments distinctly wider than preceding flagellar segments<tei:lb/>(Fig. 306). Head, viewed frontally, with sparse scattered hairs, antennal sockets pronounced, subocular<tei:lb/>suture (malar suture) distinct, with weak aberrant sculpture on either side, occipital carina distinct, with<tei:lb/>long hairs on lateral margins. Pronotal plate, viewed frontodorsally, with posterior part with a flattened<tei:lb/>dorsal margin, laterally rounded, anterior and posterior parts fused by a medial bridge, fovea on either side<tei:lb/>closed (cf. Fig. 300). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, anterior parallel lines indicated, notaulices absent,<tei:lb/>scattered hairs in their place; lateral bars of scutellum polished, scutellar foveae kidney-shaped; scutellar<tei:lb/>disc reticulate-rugose, conical at apex, not beak-shaped (Fig. 307), cup elliptical, rim pale, a fovea at base<tei:lb/>and apex. Pronotum smooth, polished either side of pronotal plate; mesopleural suture distinct, meta-<tei:lb/>pleura ridged near junction with hind coxa. Propodeal carinae weakly bowed, strongly pubescent on either<tei:lb/>side, nucha ridged. Segment 1 of gaster crenulate, partially obscured by a ring of hairs at base of tergite 2,<tei:lb/>apex of tergite 2 with light punctures, tergites 3-5 partially visible in lateral view, punctate, hypopygium<tei:lb/>pronounced (Fig. 312). Colour: head, thorax and gaster dark chestnut-red-brown, legs<tei:lb/>orange-yellow, antenna yellowish basally, apical segments blackish orange-brown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, filiform, with indistinct 5-segmented club, segment 3 shorter than<tei:lb/>4, 9-13 with rhinaria, forming a very weak club (Fig. 309). Fig. 324). Pronotum pubescent on either side of pronotal plate, not striated; mesopleural<tei:lb/>suture distinct, ventral margin of mesopleura pubescent, metapleura pubescent on apical margin;<tei:lb/>mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent, a few scattered hairs in their place; lateral bars of<tei:lb/>scutellum polished, scutellar fovea smooth, polished, scutellar disc reticulate-rugose, conical to beak-<tei:lb/>shaped viewed dorsally (Figs 310, 339), scutellar cup longer than broad.          <tei:p>Trichoplasta gracilicornis (Kieffer)<tei:lb/>(Figs 344, 346)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Coneucoela gracilicornis Kieffer, 1910a: 534. Holotype $, MADAGASCAR (ZM).<tei:lb/>Odonteucoila gracilicornis (Kieffer) Weld, 1944: 63; Masner, 1960: 356 (redescribed).<tei:lb/>Trichoplasta gracilicornis (Kieffer) Nordlander, 1982a: 272.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented filiform, club 6-segmented, segments 3 and 4 subequal in length, 5<tei:lb/>shorter than 4, segments 6-11 each subequal to 3, subequal to each other, 12 and 13 each fractionally<tei:lb/>shorter than 6, equal to 3, club segments very slightly wider than preceding segments, not forming a distinct<tei:lb/>club (Fig. 346). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, subocular suture distinct, antennal sockets<tei:lb/>pronounced, frons weakly raised, occipital carina distinct in dorsal view. Pronotal plate, viewed fronto-<tei:lb/>dorsally, weakly rounded on posterior margin, lateral margins straight, diverging, posterior and anterior<tei:lb/>parts of plate bridged laterally and medially to enclose two foveae or pits (cf. Fig. 344), anterior area<tei:lb/>striated. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, with a few scattered hairs, lateral lines (parapsidial furrows) very<tei:lb/>weakly indicated apically; lateral bars of scutellum polished dorsally, scutellar foveae shallow, lenticular,<tei:lb/>scutellar disc reticulate-rugose, conical at apex, not spine- or beak-shaped, scutellar cup large, almost oval,<tei:lb/>with a pale rim, inner margins of rim with a circle of small punctures, surface of cup weakly striated basally,<tei:lb/>base of cup with a small eliptical fovea. Pronotum, viewed laterally, smooth, shining; mesopleural suture<tei:lb/>distinct, metapleura polished. Propodeal carina almost parallel, bowed medially, lateral margins densely<tei:lb/>pubescent, weakly pubescent medially; nucha ridged, pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster partially obscured by<tei:lb/>a dense ring of hairs at base of tergite 2 , visible part of tergite 1 crenulate . Segment 2 of gaster the largest in<tei:lb/>lateral view, segments 3 and 4 partially visible in lateral view, hypopygium produced. Wing surfaces<tei:lb/>pubescent, with apical hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on wing margin, vein M (cubitus)<tei:lb/>indicated, not pigmented. Colour: head, thorax and gaster chestnut-brown, legs yellowish orange, antenna<tei:lb/>yellowish basally, apical segments darker.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED<tei:lb/>South Africa: 1 $ (BMNH). Zaire: 4 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species was intended as the basis for the erection of the genus Coneucoela Kieffer, 1910a,<tei:lb/>but was published subsequent to the description of Coneucoela brasiliensis Kieffer, 1909. Thus brasiliensis<tei:lb/>is the type-species of Coneucoela. Nordlander (19820) transferred gracilicornis to Trichoplasta. I have not<tei:lb/>been able to see the holotype of gracilicornis but have used Masner's keys (1960) to Odonteucoila, the<tei:lb/>redescription of gracilicornis, and Kieffer's original description to identify the material listed above on<tei:lb/>which the figures are based.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>.Trichoplasta longispina (Masner)<tei:lb/>(Figs 300, 335, 336)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Odonteucoila longispina Masner, 1960: 358. Holotype $, SOUTH AFRICA (NCISA).<tei:lb/>Trichoplasta longispina (Masner) Nordlander, 1982a: 273.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, with distinct 5-segmented club, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4-6<tei:lb/>subequal in length, equal in width, 7-10 equal in length, 1 1 and 12 equal in length, each shorter than 6, 13 as<tei:lb/>long as 10 (Fig. 336). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, with sparse hairs, frons raised, subocular<tei:lb/>sulcus distinct; pronotum polished laterally. Pronotal plate, viewed fronto-dorsally, straight on posterior<tei:lb/>margin, angled laterally, anterior and posterior parts of plate joined by a medial bridge, fovea on either<tei:lb/>side of bridge enclosed laterally (cf. Fig. 300). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, with a few scattered hairs;<tei:lb/>lateral bars of scutellum smooth, polished dorsally; scutellar foveae lenticular, scutellar disc with radiating<tei:lb/>reticulate-rugose, apex acute, spine-shaped, scutellar cup large, almost oval, surface raised medially, with<tei:lb/>a pale outer rim, base with a small elliptical fovea (Fig. 335).          <tei:p>AFROTROPICAL EUCOILIDAE 317</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED<tei:lb/>Zaire: 1 $ (MRAC).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. I have not seen determined material of this species, but the specimen from Zaire referred to<tei:lb/>above compares well with Masner's description and figures (1960). The species is included in the key purely<tei:lb/>on the basis of the description, but the figures are based on the specimen from Zaire.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Trichoplasta medlia sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 297, 300, 301, 331)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, clavate, segment 3 longer than 4, 4 and 5 subequal, 6 longer than<tei:lb/>5, 7-13 forming a weak club (Fig. 301). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, elongate, subocular<tei:lb/>sulcus distinct, antennal sockets protruding, ocelli equidistant, occipital carina distinct. Pronotal plate with<tei:lb/>anterior and posterior parts fused laterally, medial bridge narrow, fovea either side of ridge elongate,<tei:lb/>posterior part of plate, viewed frontally, angular, anterior part projected, with weak transverse striations<tei:lb/>(Fig. 300); pronotum either side of pronotal plate with dense tufts of hair. Pronotum smooth, polished<tei:lb/>laterally; meopleural suture distinct, metapleura with a number of ridges; mesoscutum smooth, polished,<tei:lb/>without trace of notaulices; scutellar fovea large, polished; lateral bars of scutellum polished; scutellar disc<tei:lb/>coarsely reticulate-rugose, apex beak-shaped, viewed laterally it appears elevated; scutellar cup large, oval<tei:lb/>(Fig. 297), concave in apical region. Propodeal carinae almost parallel, medial area weakly pubescent,<tei:lb/>densely pubescent on outer margins of carinae, nucha ridged, base of metapleura with tufts of pubescence.<tei:lb/>Segment 1 of gaster not visible, obscured by a dense ring of hairs at base of tergite 2, complete on dorsal<tei:lb/>surface, tergite 2 densely punctate apically, segment 3 partially visible in lateral view, punctate, hypo-<tei:lb/>pygium not protruding. Legs short, stout, coxae swollen, elongate, with a fringe of hairs on side margins.<tei:lb/>Wing surfaces pubescent, with apical fringe of hairs, radial cell of forewing closed on margin, venation<tei:lb/>pallid, cell longer than broad (Fig. 299). Colour: head, thorax and gaster blackish to dark chestnut-red,<tei:lb/>antenna and legs reddish yellow.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Cf . Antenna 15-segmented, filiform, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4 weakly swollen medially, very slightly<tei:lb/>longer than 5 (Fig. 331).</tei:p>

         <tei:p>REMARKS. This species is very closely related to rufus but is distinguished by the sculpture of the scutellar<tei:lb/>disc and the antennal segment ratios.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Trichoplasta narrata sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 304, 305, 324)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $. Antenna 13-segmented, weakly clavate, with indistinct 6-segmented club, club segments<tei:lb/>with rhinaria, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4 longer than 5, 5 and 6 subequal, 7 shorter than 6, 8-13 subequal in<tei:lb/>length, each as long as 7, weakly swollen medially (Fig. 305), darker than basal segments. Head, viewed<tei:lb/>frontally, smooth, polished, antennal sockets protruding, subocular sulcus distinct, occipital carina well<tei:lb/>defined. Pronotal plate, viewed frontodorsally, with typically enclosed fovea either side of medial bridge<tei:lb/>between anterior and posterior parts of plate (cf. Fig. 324), posterior part of plate rounded dorsally,<tei:lb/>anterior part angled laterally. Pronotum either side of plate with tufts of pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth,<tei:lb/>polished; lateral bars of scutellum smooth, polished, scutellar fovea deep, clearly separated, polished;<tei:lb/>scutellar disc reticulate-rugose, apex beak-like, acutely pointed, cup large, with apical fovea. Mesopleural<tei:lb/>suture very fine, metapleura polished, weakly ridged, with a tuft of pubescence on anterior margin, nucha<tei:lb/>ridged, with long scattered pubescence. Segment 1 of gaster crenulate, partially obscured by a ring of<tei:lb/>pubescence at base of tergite 2 which is impunctate, remaining tergites not visible in lateral view,<tei:lb/>hypopygium pronounced. Legs slender, coxae with a hair fringe on outer margins. Wing surfaces<tei:lb/>pubescent, with long apical hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on wing margin, vein M (cubitus)<tei:lb/>indicated, not pigmented. Colour: head brownish, thorax and gaster orange-brown, antenna yellow<tei:lb/>basally, apical segments brownish.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Trichoplasta novema sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 324, 328, 332, 333)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, clavate, segment 3 longer than 4, 4 shorter than 5, 5-13 forming a<tei:lb/>very distinct club (Fig. 328). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, frons raised, with distinct lateral<tei:lb/>margins extending from raised antennal sockets, subocular sulcus (malar suture) distinct, with weak ridges<tei:lb/>on either side, occipital carina pronounced dorsally. Pronotal plate, viewed frontodorsally, weakly<tei:lb/>rounded, lateral margins more angular, anterior and posterior parts fused medially and laterally to enclose<tei:lb/>a fovea on either side of medial bridge, medial bridge narrow, fovea elongate, distinct, anterior part of<tei:lb/>plate weakly sculptured (Fig. 324). Pronotum pubescent either side of pronotal plate with a few<tei:lb/>canaliculations on lower lateral margins. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura ridged on lower margins<tei:lb/>(Fig. 334). Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices absent; scutellar foveae kidney-shaped, lateral bars<tei:lb/>of scutellum with weak aberrant sculpture apically, scutellar disc with punctate-reticulate-rugose sculpture<tei:lb/>(Fig. 332), apex conical, scutellar cup large, almost circular, with a round fovea apically (Fig. 332).<tei:lb/>Propodeal carinae horseshoe-shaped, weakly pubescent medially, densely pubescent on lateral margins,<tei:lb/>nucha pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of tergite 2 which is<tei:lb/>very weakly punctate apically, segment 3 partially visible in lateral view, hypopygium weakly produced.<tei:lb/>Legs slender, coxae narrow, sparsely pubescent. Wing surfaces pubescent, with apical hair fringe, radial<tei:lb/>cell of fore wing elongate, open on wing margin, venation yellowish, vein M (cubitus) indicated, weakly<tei:lb/>pigmented basally (Fig. 333). Colour: head and thorax blackish, gaster chestnut-brown, antenna blackish<tei:lb/>brown, except basal segments lighter.<tei:lb/>C? unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>Trichoplasta octonarius sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 354, 355, 356)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, clavate, segment 3 longer than 4, 4 and 5 subequal, 6-13 forming<tei:lb/>a distinct club (Fig. 354). Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, frontal ridges prominent in proximity<tei:lb/>to antennal sockets which protrude, occipital carina pronounced, subocular suture distinct. Pronotal plate<tei:lb/>with anterior and posterior parts fused medially and laterally to enclose a fovea either side of medial<tei:lb/>bridge, medial bridge narrow, posterior part of plate rounded, anterior part angular on lower margins,<tei:lb/>anterior part smooth, polished. Pronotum viewed laterally pubescent either side of pronotal plate, with<tei:lb/>strong transverse striations extending to mesopleura. Mesopleural suture distinct, metapleura with five<tei:lb/>ridges. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, without trace of notaulices; scutellar foveae large, polished, with a<tei:lb/>hole in basal corner ending under lateral bars of scutellum which are polished; scutellar disc reticulate-<tei:lb/>rugose, apex conical, scutellar cup large, almost round, basal half with weak striations, apical half with a<tei:lb/>large fovea (Fig. 356). Propodeal carina broad, parallel, densely pubescent; nucha ridged; margin of<tei:lb/>metapleura pubescent. Segment 1 of gaster not visible, obscured by a ring of dense pubescence at base of<tei:lb/>tergite 2, apical two-thirds of tergite 2 punctate, tergites 3 and 4 visible laterally, hypopygium strongly<tei:lb/>produced. Legs short, coxae swollen, elongate, sparsely pubescent. Wing surfaces pubescent, with apical<tei:lb/>hair fringe, radial cell of forewing open on wing margin, longer than broad, venation pale, vein M (cubitus)<tei:lb/>visible, not pigmented (Fig. 355). Colour: head, thorax and gaster blackish, antenna orange-yellow<tei:lb/>basally, darker apically, legs orange-yellow.<tei:lb/>C? unknown.</tei:p>

         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, filiform, with weak 5-segmented club, segment 3 shorter than 4,<tei:lb/>4-7 subequal in length, 8 and 9 subequal, each shorter than 7, 10-13 each slightly shorter than 9 (Fig. 343).<tei:lb/>Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, with long scattered hairs, cheeks converging, antennal sockets<tei:lb/>protruding, frons raised, subocular sulcus distinct, occipital carina distinct on dorsal margin, obscured by<tei:lb/>tufts of pubescence either side of pronotal plate which, viewed frontodorsally, is rounded posteriorly.<tei:lb/>Pronotal plate with anterior and posterior parts fused medially and laterally to enclose a fovea either side of<tei:lb/>medial bridge (Fig. 344).          <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. 9 . Antenna 13-segmented, segment 3 subequal to 4+5, 6 longer than 4 or 5, 7-13 subequal in<tei:lb/>length, all distinctly wider than preceding flagellar segments and forming a sharply defined club (Fig. 329).<tei:lb/>Head, viewed frontally, smooth, shining, rounded, frons raised, eyes same distance apart as height of an<tei:lb/>eye, malar space with a carina and weak striations on lower side, vertex smooth, shining.          <tei:p>REMARKS. Trichoplasta tanganyikensis (Weld) was originally assigned to Coneucoela. Benoit (1956)<tei:lb/>established the genus Trichoplasta and designated basilewskyi as type-species. Nordlander (1982a)<tei:lb/>synonymised both species. Masner (1960) and Nordlander (1978a, 1980) had previously regarded<tei:lb/>Odonteucoila a genus in which Masner had described a number of species now recognised as belonging in<tei:lb/>Trichoplasta as being closely related to Rhoptromeris . The type-species of Odonteucoila, however, belongs<tei:lb/>to those groups of genera with the lateral cavities of the pronotal plate open.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Trichoplasta testacea sp. n.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>(Figs 347, 349, 350, 351)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. 9- Antenna 13-segmented, clavate, with a 6-segmented club, segment 3 shorter than 4, 4<tei:lb/>longer than 5, 5 shorter than 6, first club segment slightly less broad than others (Fig. 349), all with rhinaria.<tei:lb/>Head, viewed frontally, smooth, polished, with a line of hairs extending from base of clypeus to antennal<tei:lb/>sockets, subocular sulcus present, occipital carina distinct viewed dorsally. Pronotal plate, viewed<tei:lb/>frontodorsally, with two foveae, one each side of medial bridge between anterior and posterior parts of<tei:lb/>plate, fovea closed laterally, sides of plate angular (Fig. 351), pronotum either side of plate with dense tufts<tei:lb/>of pubescence. Mesoscutum smooth, polished, notaulices very weakly indicated anteriorly by a few<tei:lb/>scattered hairs in their place; lateral bars of scutellum very weakly indicated; scutellar foveae kidney-<tei:lb/>shaped, smooth, polished; scutellar disc shining, weakly areolate, apex sharply tapered, scutellar cup long,<tei:lb/>narrow, apex with a small declined fovea (Fig. 350). Pronotum smooth on lateral margins; mesopleural<tei:lb/>suture distinct, metapleura smooth, pubescent on anterior margins; nucha ridged. Segment 1 of gaster<tei:lb/>obscured by a ring of hairs at base of tergite 2, incomplete on dorsal surface, apex of tergite 2 impunctate,<tei:lb/>tergite 3 partially visible, hypopygium pronounced. Legs long, slender, coxae and tibiae weakly pubescent.<tei:lb/>Wing surfaces pubescent, apical margins with a hair fringe, radial cell of forewing closed on wing margin<tei:lb/>(Fig. 347), vein M (cubitus) not indicated.          <tei:p>DESCRIPTION. $ . Antenna 13-segmented, weakly clavate, with a 6-segmented club, segment 3 shorter than<tei:lb/>4, 5-10 subequal in length, segments 8-13 broader medially than segments 3-7 (Fig. 319). Fig. 351). Fig. 320). Lateral margins of pronotum, mesopleura and metapleura polished. Mesopleu-<tei:lb/>ral suture distinct, metapleura with weak ridges, lower edges with tufts of hairs. Propodeal carinae parallel,<tei:lb/>weakly pubescent; nucha ridged, pubescent. Legs long, slender, pubescent, coxae elongate. Colour: head and thorax brownish black, gaster brownish<tei:lb/>yellow, legs orange-yellow, antenna yellow basally, apical segments darkish.<tei:lb/>Cf unknown.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>MATERIAL EXAMINED</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Holotype $, Cameroun: Mt Cameroon, Mann's Quelle, 7400 ft (2250 m), 30.U932 (M. Steele)<tei:lb/>(BMNH).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paratypes. Cameroun: 3 $ (BMNH), same data as holotype (one damaged).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>REMARKS. Distinguished from the closely related species gracilicornis by the antennal segment ratios.</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>322 J. QUINLAN</tei:p>

      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>Occasional Papers on Systematic Entomology</tei:p>
         <tei:p>New Series</tei:p>
         <tei:p>The economic importance of insects, and the enormous number of species, have resulted in a<tei:lb/>vast literature written in many languages; that which is of direct economic importance and<tei:lb/>recently published can, to an increasing extent, be searched by using computerized data bases,<tei:lb/>but a great amount of more general information is unlikely to be available so readily in the<tei:lb/>near future. The objective of this new occasional series is to make available in hard copy some<tei:lb/>of the basic data that is essential to the preparation of comprehensive accounts of the world<tei:lb/>insect fauna. The papers have been fully researched bibliographically and consist of checklists<tei:lb/>of nominal taxa, and faunal lists with information on host plants and localities, based mainly<tei:lb/>on the collections and libraries of the British Museum (Natural History).</tei:p>
         <tei:p>No. 1. A checklist of Neotropical arctiine and pericopine tiger moths.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>A. Watson &amp; D. T. Goodger</tei:p>
         <tei:p>72pp. inc. 4 colour plates 27 February 1986</tei:p>
         <tei:p>No. 2. An annotated checklist of the Carabidae (including Cicindelinae, Rhysodinae and</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Paussinae) recorded from Borneo.</tei:p>
         <tei:p>N. E. Stork</tei:p>
         <tei:p>26pp. , 1 map 24 April 1986</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Catalogues of BM (NH) Bulletins and Books free on request to Publication Sales.</tei:p>
         <tei:pb/>
      </tei:div>
      <tei:div>
         <tei:p>Titles to be published in Volume 52</tei:p>
         <tei:p>The sandflies of Egypt (Diptera: Phlebotominae)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>By R. P. Lane</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Fungus moths: a review of the Scardiinae (Lepidoptera: Tineidae)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>ByG. S.Robinson</tei:p>
         <tei:p>A revision of the European Agathidinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae)</tei:p>
         <tei:p>By G. E. J. Nixon</tei:p>
         <tei:p>A key to the Afrotropical genera of Eucoilidae (Hymenoptera), with a revision of certain genera</tei:p>
         <tei:p>By J. Quinlan</tei:p>
         <tei:p>Photoset by Rowland Phototypesetting Ltd, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk<tei:lb/>Printed in Great Britain by Henry Ling Ltd, Dorchester</tei:p>
